programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Tammy and Carter continue to investigate the suspicious death aboard a COVID-infected ship offshore, Pride and the team discover that the PPE they were sent to distribute may hold the key to finding the killer. Also, Rita returns to New Orleans to surprise Pride, Wade helps a grieving woman who can't find her brother who died from COVID-19, and Patton and his goddaughter get into a heated argument.

programme.title: All Rise
programme.desc: With Ness nearing the end of her clerkship, Lola sets her up to shadow Emily, who is defending a young man who reoffended, and the verdict lies with Judge Campbell who is notoriously harsh on repeat offenders. Also, Rachel reveals to Lola that she kissed Mark, and Mark struggles to find out why Luke's name is on a list of cops dropped off by Deep Throat.

programme.title: Finding Your Roots With Henry Louis Gates Jr.
American Experience
programme.desc: The 1992 siege at Ruby Ridge in Idaho, which fueled anti-government sentiments, is recalled. The incident came about when white separatist Randy Weaver, charged with selling two sawed-off shotguns, failed to appear in court and holed up at his cabin. A firefight erupted between U.S. marshals scouting the area and Weaver's son Sam and friend Kevin Harris; Sam and a marshal were killed. Weaver was then shot and his wife Vicki killed. Former Green Beret Bo Gritz negotiated an end to the standoff.

programme.title: Blue Bloods

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: After Anthony is shot while interviewing a witness for an upcoming murder trial, Erin enlists Anthony's archenemy, Danny, to find out who was responsible. programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: When Henry is the key witness on Danny and Baez's case, his meddling pushes Danny's buttons until he leads them to valuable information. programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: When a student is shot by a rival gang member in his high school courtyard, Danny and Baez try to get a grasp on the situation to prevent a reoccurrence, but the principal recklessly takes matters into his own hands. Also, Erin tries to help a friend who is mixed up in an illegal gambling ring; and Gov. Mendez tries to frame Frank after one of his top legislative aides is shot by an NYPD officer.

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Danny considers taking a new job that would ease his financial struggles after investigating the death of a wealthy man. programme.title: Blue Bloods

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: After Danny's brother-in-law gets caught up with the mob and steals Danny's credit card, Danny forces him to take down the mobsters with Baez's help. programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: After a woman voices her outrage regarding the NYPD's inability to find her son's murderer, Danny reexamines the case, upsetting the original detective, Erin, and Anthony, who didn't pursue the case due to lack of evidence. programme.desc: While Dwight helps Michael buy a condo, Jim runs the games of the office olympiad, time-killing contests played with office supplies. Carol: Nancy Walls. Bill: John H. Bland. Neighbor: Greg Daniels.

programme.desc: During a fire evacuation, Michael tries to convey 10 rules of business to Ryan; and Jim promotes \"psychologically revealing conversations.\" Katy: Amy Adams. Ryan: B.J. Novak. Jim: John Krasinski. Dwight: Rainn Wilson.

programme.desc: After Dwight karate punches Michael, Jim sets up a lunchtime rematch at Dwight's dojo, where Pam becomes annoyed by Jim's friendliness.

programme.desc: Michael is a surprising asset in helping Jan woo a client. But while he's out, staffers find and act out his screenplay.

programme.title: Classic College Basketball
programme.desc: From 1985: Ohio State at Minnesota in a Big Ten thriller. The Buckeyes edged the Gophers 78-77 in Minneapolis.

programme.title: Classic College Football
programme.desc: From 1981: Ohio State at Michigan. The Buckeyes upset Michigan 14-9 when Art Schlichter scored on a six-yard run with 2:50 left in the game. It was his final regular-season appearance for the Buckeyes.

programme.title: Classic College Football
programme.desc: From 2000: Northwestern at Minnesota. The Wildcats stunned Minnesota 41-35 on a 45-yard Hail Mary touchdown on the final play. Damien Anderson rushed for 230 yards and two scores for Northwestern.

programme.title: Classic College Football
programme.desc: From 1977: Ohio State at Michigan in a Big Ten showdown. The Wolverines got by State 14-6 in Ann Arbor.

programme.title: Classic College Football
programme.desc: From 1981: Clemson at South Carolina. The Tigers beat their state rival 29-13 to conclude their first perfect regular season since 1948.

programme.title: Classic College Football
programme.desc: From 1979: Ohio State at Michigan. The Buckeyes edged Michigan, 18-15.

programme.title: Classic College Football
programme.desc: From 1969: Ohio State at Michigan. The Wolverines beat OSU 24-12 in Bo Schembechler's first \"Big Game.\" The loss snapped a 22-game winning streak for the Buckeyes.

programme.title: Classic College Football
programme.desc: From 1984: Clemson at South Carolina. The second-ranked Tigers rolled to a 29-13 win as Chuck McSwain rushed for 151 yards and two touchdowns.

programme.title: Classic College Football
programme.desc: From 1997: Georgia at Georgia Tech. The visiting Bulldogs edged Tech 27-24 in Atlanta.

programme.title: Classic College Football
programme.desc: From 1999: Georgia at Georgia Tech. The Yellow Jackets edged Georgia 51-48 in overtime. Joe Hamilton threw for 341 yards and 4 TDs for the winners, while Quincy Carter had 345 yards and 3 TDs through the air.

programme.title: Classic College Football
programme.desc: From 2009: Notre Dame at Stanford. The Cardinal won 45-38, with Toby Gerhart running for 205 yards and 3 TDs, and passing for another.

programme.title: Classic College Football
programme.desc: From 1995: Ohio State at Michigan. The Wolverines upset second-ranked OSU 31-23 behind Tim Biakabutuka's 313 rushing yards.

programme.title: Classic College Football
programme.desc: From 1995: Georgia Tech at Georgia. The Bulldogs edged Tech 18-17 on Kanon Parkman's 34-yard FG with 47 seconds left.

programme.title: Classic College Football
programme.desc: From 1981: Ohio State at Michigan. The Buckeyes upset Michigan 14-9 when Art Schlichter scored on a six-yard run with 2:50 left in the game. It was his final regular-season appearance for the Buckeyes.

programme.title: Classic College Football
programme.desc: From 1995: Florida State vs. Florida in the Sugar Bowl in New Orleans. The Seminoles downed Florida 23-17 despite Danny Wuerffel's record 394 yards passing.

programme.title: Classic College Football
programme.desc: From 1993: Florida State at Florida. The Seminoles outscored Florida 33-21. Charlie Ward threw for 446 yards, including a 79-yard TD pass to Warrick Dunn with 5:28 to play.

programme.desc: A religious-themed newsmagazine, one of TV's longest-running programs. Conservative icon (and 1988 presidential candidate) Pat Robertson founded the hugely popular program from a 1963 fund-raising pledge effort on UHF TV in Virginia.

programme.title: Beverly Hills, 90210
programme.desc: The trendy, long-running drama about pretty kids with ugly problems followed a pack of Gen-Xers from high school to post-collegiate life, while turning the cast into teen idols and helping Fox buff its youth-oriented image. Soapy and addictive, it tackled serious issues aplenty, including date rape, gun control, bulimia, steroids and substance abuse of every sort. It spun off the similarly popular 'Melrose Place' and offered early gigs to Hilary Swank, Peter Krause, Dean Cain and Vivica A. Fox.

programme.desc: Best Picture winner about a black police detective from Philadelphia who forces a bigoted Southern sheriff to accept his help with a homicide investigation after a wealthy Chicago businessman is murdered in a small Mississippi town. The film spawned two sequels and a TV-drama.

programme.title: Inherit the Wind
programme.desc: Version of the Broadway hit about 1925's Scopes \"Monkey Trial\" in Tennessee, where high-school teacher John Scopes was arrested for teaching Darwin's theory of evolution in violation of state law. The resulting trial brought together two titans of the legal profession, one \"belching platitudes\" of creationism and the other championing the evolutionist cause.

programme.title: Inside Daisy Clover
programme.desc: A teenage tomboy becomes a film star of the 1930s and weathers some shattering personal experiences at the hands of her studio and from assorted Hollywood types.

programme.title: Interiors
programme.desc: Writer-director Woody Allen's austere, Bergman-esque study of alienation focuses on three sisters (Diane Keaton, Kristin Griffith, Mary Beth Hurt) trying to comfort their depressed, newly separated mother (Geraldine Page). The film was nominated for five Oscars, including Best Director. E.G. Marshall, Maureen Stapleton, Richard Jordan, Sam Waterston.

programme.title: Irene
programme.desc: A Cinderella story about an Irish lass who lands a job at an expensive New York boutique, where she's pursued by the store owner and a wealthy socialite.

programme.title: It Happened on Fifth Avenue
programme.desc: A vagabond moves into a New York City mansion while the owner is wintering down South and opens the doors to a number of unfortunates, including the vacationer's daughter, whom the squatter mistakes for a down-on-her-luck runaway from an abusive father.

programme.title: It Happened One Night
programme.desc: Frank Capra's classic about a spoiled heiress on the lam from her father, and the gruff reporter who hooks up with her as they travel northward, engage in a series of misadventures and begin to fall for each other. The first film to sweep all five major Oscars: Best Picture, Director (Capra), Screenplay (Robert Riskin), Actor (Clark Gable) and Actress (Claudette Colbert).

programme.title: It Happened Tomorrow
programme.desc: A reporter supernaturally receives tomorrow's newspaper, giving him hot scoops. Then he sees his own obituary. Witty and suspenseful.

programme.title: It Should Happen to You
programme.desc: Judy Holliday is a delight in this farce about an unsuccessful model who believes her career needs a jolt of publicity, so she rents a billboard in Manhattan, emblazoned with her name on it, and sees the endorsements pour in as well as the suitors. Jack Lemmon made his screen debut as Holliday's \"unofficial\" boyfriend.

programme.title: It's a Great Feeling
programme.desc: When Hollywood actors decide to get a director for their new movie, they need a star and recruit a cafeteria waitress who wants to break into the business.

programme.title: It's a Mad Mad Mad Mad World (?)
programme.desc: Comic mayhem ensues when a large number of people scramble to find $350,000 supposedly hidden by a man who passes away after causing a major traffic jam in this all-star comedy.

programme.title: It's Always Fair Weather
programme.desc: World War II service buddies reunite in a New York City bar 10 years after their discharge only to find they haven't that much in common anymore, until one of them gets in over his head with mobsters and the other two try to help him out of the jam. Directed by Stanley Donen and Gene Kelly, who stars as one of the three GIs.

programme.title: Ivanhoe
programme.desc: Best Picture nominee set in the Middle Ages is a swashbuckling version of Sir Walter Scott's classic romance of star-crossed love that involves a dashing knight torn between a Saxon beauty and comely Jewish maiden.

programme.title: Jezebel
programme.desc: A haughty antebellum Southern Belle loses her sweetheart when she wears a scandalous dress to a ball where all young ladies wear white.

programme.title: Johnny Belinda
programme.desc: Jane Wyman won an Oscar for her portrayal of a deaf woman living a hardscrabble life in a Nova Scotia fishing village, where she is taught to communicate by a young doctor. Later, she is raped by a local lout, and charged when he is later found murdered. The film was nominated for 12 Oscars, including Best Picture, Director (Jean Negulesco) and Actor (Lew Ayres), but Wyman's was the only win.

programme.title: Johnny Eager
programme.desc: A college student falls in love with a ruthless racketeer, who uses her to blackmail the district attorney, her stepfather, in an effort to get him to allow the reopening of a mob-related dog-racing track. Van Heflin won a Best Supporting Actor Oscar as the gangster's dedicated right-hand man.

programme.title: Juarez
programme.desc: The story of 19th-century Mexican revolutionary Benito Juarez and his opposition to the puppet rule of Maximilian I, which had been installed in Mexico by France's Napoleon III.

programme.title: Juliet of the Spirits
programme.desc: A neglected Italian housewife is haunted by visions of spirits while resisting the temptations of carnal lust and dealing with a philandering husband.

programme.title: Julius Caesar
programme.desc: \"Friends, Romans, countrymen\" and critics heaped praise and a Best Picture nomination on Shakespeare's historical drama of tyranny, deceit, political betrayal and assassination in ancient Rome. Marlon Brando was nominated for Best Actor as Marc Antony.

programme.title: Jungle Book
programme.desc: Adaptation of Rudyard Kipling's adventure about a lad raised by wolves in the jungles of India, where he tries to adapt to the \"civilized\" world, but then stumbles upon a rare treasure that leads to further discoveries---of corruption and evil.

programme.title: Key Largo
programme.desc: An adaptation of the Maxwell Anderson play about a war-weary World War II vet forced into a confrontation with the nervous, sadistic mobster who is holding the occupants of a Florida hotel hostage during a hurricane. Claire Trevor won a Supporting Actress Oscar as the gangster's drunken moll.

programme.title: The King of Jazz
programme.desc: Revue featuring animation and performances by the Paul Whiteman orchestra, Bing Crosby, John Boles, Laura La Plante, Glenn Tryon, Jeanette Loff, Stanley Smith. Directed by John Murray Anderson.

programme.title: King Solomon's Mines
programme.desc: The wife of an adventurer hires an explorer to find her missing husband, who never came back from an expedition to find the legendary diamond mines of the Biblical ruler. A Best Picture nominee.

programme.title: Kings Row
programme.desc: A one-time playboy becomes the victim of a vengeful doctor in this drama about murder, insanity and sadism in a small town at the turn of the century.

programme.title: Kismet
programme.desc: The venerable fantasy about a wily beggar-magician masquerading as a prince in Baghdad, where he woos the favorite wife of the Grand Vizier and schemes to get his daughter matched up with a handsome caliph. Features a memorable Marlene Dietrich dance sequence in which she is painted gold from head to toe.

programme.title: Kiss Me Kate
programme.desc: A pair of divorced actors come together to star in a musical stage adaptation of Shakespeare's \"The Taming of the Shrew,\" and soon find their feelings resembling those of the characters.

programme.title: Kisses for My President
programme.desc: When the first woman is elected to the office of President of the United States, her husband has a tough time adapting to the role of male \"First Lady,\" especially when a Latin American dictator develops a less-than-diplomatic interest in the Leader of the Free World.

programme.title: Kitty Foyle
programme.desc: A working-class woman marries a wealthy man for his money, rather than the poor doctor she genuinely loves, and quickly clashes with her husband's family. Eventually she breaks away from him, only to find out she's carrying his child. Ginger Rogers won a Best Actress Oscar as the titular character.

programme.title: Knights of the Round Table
programme.desc: A group of artists recreate the stories inspired by the adventures of Lancelot and Merlin.

programme.title: La Ronde
programme.desc: An omniscient guide narrates a series of interconnected romantic affairs in 1900 Vienna. The encounters feature a prostitute, a soldier, a chambermaid, a married woman, her husband, and a poet. Based on the play \"Reigen\" by Arthur Schnitzler.

programme.title: La Strada
programme.desc: Federico Fellini's Oscar-winning Best Foreign Language Film is the tale of the relationship between a brutish carnival strongman and his simpleminded assistant as they tour the Italian countryside.

programme.title: Ladies in Retirement
programme.desc: To protect her two insane sisters, Ellen Creed will stop at nothing. Skillfully directed. Fine acting in this macabre tale of the English marsh country.

programme.desc: Married songwriters go through a series of ups and downs over the years, including divorce and remarriage.

programme.title: The Ladykillers

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Detectives investigate a string of hate crimes against gay men, and the victims include the new fiancé of Fin's son. A private-school teacher is then similarly brutalized, and the evidence in his case points to a possible cover-up.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Police dive into an underground world of self-mutilation and ritual amputation while searching for a missing woman. When a cleanly severed leg is found, the detectives look for links between their current investigation and a possibly similar cold case.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit

programme.desc: All New Sal, Murr, Joe and Q play matchmakers at the food court, then switch fields to pose as architects, sharing some perplexing new building technology. Plus, tonight's big loser makes a connection while networking - and won't let go.

programme.title: Impractical Jokers
programme.desc: All New Murr, Q, Joe and Sal participate in a fake documentary, then find themselves in the middle of a marshmallow throwing contest. Plus, tonight's big loser is the host with the least when he can't find customers' dinner reservations.

programme.title: The Way Back
programme.desc: An alcoholic who has endured family tragedy works to redeem himself by coaching his high school alma mater's basketball team. But as he's brought back to his glory days as a promising athlete, he's forced to confront the demons that derailed him earlier in life.

programme.title: Forces of Nature
programme.desc: Ben Affleck is an airplane passenger traveling to his wedding in Georgia and Sandra Bullock is the charmer seated next to him in this delightful romance. When their flight experiences trouble, they decide to find other modes of transportation. Fighting, flirting and hitching rides, they seem destined to be together---despite his impending nuptials.

programme.title: New Year's Eve
programme.desc: Featuring an all-star cast including Robert De Niro, Katherine Heigl and Sarah Jessica Parker, this engaging comedy-drama follows a variety of couples and singles as they roam the streets of New York City on New Year's Eve.

programme.title: Tully
programme.desc: At the encouragement of her brother, Marlo, an overwhelmed mother of three, and her husband Drew hire a young night nurse named Tully to care for their newborn. Tully becomes a confidant for Marlo, who is grappling with her identity as a wife and mother.

programme.title: Bigger Than the Sky
programme.desc: Marcus Thomas, Amy Smart and John Corbett star in this charming romantic comedy. Thomas plays a sad sack whose life improves when he lands the lead in a community theater production of \"Cyrano de Bergerac,\" then falls for his leading lady. Sean Astin, Clare Higgins. Al Corley directed.

programme.title: Bruce Lee: His Last Days---His Last Nights
programme.desc: Li Hsiu Hsien portrays martial artist Bruce Lee in this film that focuses on the actor's death, as well as his relationship with actress Betty Ting Pei. Also called \"Bruce Lee, His Last Days\" and \"Bruce Lee and I.\".

programme.title: Surrogates
programme.desc: This dazzling, futuristic sci-fi thriller follows Greer, an FBI agent investigating a murder in a world where people no longer go outside but instead live life through robotic surrogates controlled from their homes. As Greer amasses clues, he uncovers a conspiracy involving the people responsible for creating the surrogates.

programme.title: Cake
programme.desc: In this fascinating drama, a woman suffering from chronic pain starts seeing hallucinations of a young wife who committed suicide. Later, she gets to know the latter's husband and faces her own inner demons.

programme.title: Witless Protection
programme.desc: It's \"Blue Collar Comedy\" star Larry the Cable Guy taking on white-collar criminals in this slapstick yukfest. Larry plays a small-town cop who mistakes a government witness for a kidnap victim (Ivana Milicevic) and \"rescues\" her from her FBI protectors, who might be corrupt from their well-polished shoes to their perfectly cut hair. Yaphet Kotto costars as federal agent Alonzo Moseley, the same character he played in 1988's \"Midnight Run.\" Written and directed by Charles Robert Carner.

programme.title: Six Days, Seven Nights
programme.desc: In this romantic comedy, Anne Heche plays an ambitious magazine editor who becomes marooned on a deserted island with a gruff cargo pilot (Harrison Ford). Despite their conflicting personalities, the two castaways gradually fall for one another, even as they are besieged by mother nature and ruthless modern-day pirates. David Schwimmer, Jacqueline Obradors, Temuerra Morrison, Allison Janney.

programme.title: Blinded by the Light
programme.desc: A second-generation British-Pakistani teenager comes of age in a small town during the Thatcher era, rebelling against parental and cultural expectations and the confines of provincial life with the help of Bruce Springsteen's empowering music and relatable lyricism.

programme.title: Jersey Girl
programme.desc: Screenwriter-director Kevin Smith (\"Clerks\") ditches his profane stoners for this witty and tender comedy-drama. Ben Affleck stars as a widowed ex-publicist who returns to his humble New Jersey roots to raise his young daughter.

programme.title: The Pink Panther 2
programme.desc: The bumbling Inspector Jacques Clouseau searches for a thief who is stealing treasures from around the world, including the priceless Pink Panther diamond in this comedy of errors sequel.

programme.title: Black Rain
programme.desc: A tarnished New York cop and his younger partner run afoul of the Japanese Yakuza after escorting a crime boss to Osaka in order to stand trial.

programme.title: Surrogates
programme.desc: This dazzling, futuristic sci-fi thriller follows Greer, an FBI agent investigating a murder in a world where people no longer go outside but instead live life through robotic surrogates controlled from their homes. As Greer amasses clues, he uncovers a conspiracy involving the people responsible for creating the surrogates.

programme.title: Stigmata
programme.desc: Patricia Arquette leaves her mark in a bloody, creepy chiller about a \"self-confessed atheist\" who \"exhibits the wounds of Christ.\" Gabriel Byrne is riveting as a Vatican priest, a debunker of miracles, sent to investigate the religious phenomenon. He arrives and in due course witnesses a couple of terrifying incidents that rock his faith.

programme.title: 8 Mile
programme.desc: Hard-hitting drama about a white rapper from inner-city Detroit whose talent for wordplay inspires dreams of a career in hip-hop. The original song \"Lose Yourself\" won an Oscar.

programme.title: Alita: Battle Angel
programme.desc: A cyborg with no memories and mastery of a lost and powerful cyborg martial art awakens in a post-apocalyptic dystopia caused by a global technological catastrophe. With the help of the scientist who revived her, she confronts her many enemies in a battle for justice within a fallen world.

programme.title: The Last of the Finest
programme.desc: Lone wolf undercover cops investigate a drug trafficking ring, after they attempt a major bust that fails. They uncover a web of conspiracy that involves their fellow cops, as well as government officials.

programme.title: Showdown in Little Tokyo
programme.desc: Two culturally different detectives team up to take down a drug kingpin, who murdered one partner's parents.

programme.title: Army of Darkness
programme.desc: A discount-store employee is time-warped to a medieval castle, where he is the foretold savior who can dispel the evil there. Unfortunately, he screws up and releases an army of skeletons.

programme.title: The Watcher
programme.desc: Keanu Reeves and James Spader star in this haunting thriller about a serial killer. Troubled FBI agent Joel Campbell (Spader) goes up against a sadistic murderer (Reeves) who sends him photos of his next victims, giving him 24 hours to save them. Marisa Tomei, Ernie Hudson, Chris Ellis, Robert Cicchini, Yvonne Niami.

programme.title: American Woman (?)
programme.desc: Set in small-town Pennsylvania, a foxy grandmother in her early thirties struggles to make ends meet with her job as a supermarket cashier. She tries to provide for her 16-year-old daughter who's a single mom. Once her daughter disappears after a night out, the narrative spans the next 11 years as she raises her grandson, attempting to find real love and seeking answers for the mystery which may come at last.

programme.title: Anna
programme.desc: A strikingly beautiful woman unleashes her strength and skills in order to become one of the best government assassins in the world. Later, she is recruited by the CIA to kill KGB's head in exchanged for immediate retirement and lifetime protection.

programme.title: Grace Unplugged
programme.desc: The devoutly religious daughter of a reformed rocker experiences an acute crisis of faith after running away to L.A., and once there teaming with her father's old producer in a bid to achieve pop stardom in this compelling tale of spiritual struggle.

programme.title: Pearl Harbor
programme.desc: This epic retelling of the 1941 Japanese sneak attack on the U.S. naval base in Hawaii is marked by outstanding special effects and a bittersweet love story involving a nurse (Kate Beckinsale) and two fighter pilots (Ben Affleck, Josh Hartnett). The film features stirring performances by Jon Voight as Franklin D. Roosevelt and Cuba Gooding Jr. as Dorie Miller, a cook who shot down a plane.

programme.title: LUV
programme.desc: In this touching coming-of-age tale, an 11-year-old boy is forced to grow up fast as he tries to help his ex-con uncle open a crab shack and go straight, only to find the business venture threatened by the uncle's violent past.

programme.title: Broken City
programme.desc: In this nail-biting thriller, the mayor of NYC hires a disgraced former cop, now working as a private eye, to expose his wife's infidelities. As he does so, the PI begins to unravel a mystery that could bring about the end of more than just a marriage.

programme.title: Proof of Life
programme.desc: After her husband is kidnapped by terrorists in South America, a woman begins to fall for the mercenary hired to help rescue him in this sizzling romantic thriller.

programme.title: The Bourne Legacy
programme.desc: In this non-stop thrill ride, a scientifically engineered CIA agent goes on the run when his program is compromised, and everyone involved is ordered eliminated. Along the way, he is joined by the brilliant research scientist who helped to create him.

programme.title: Pi
programme.desc: In this award-winning intellectual thriller, a math genius (Sean Gullette) develops a dangerous obsession with an elusive 216-number sequence. He is pursued by corporate agents who are also after the number, which is tied to the stock market. Mark Margolis, Ben Shenkman. Written and directed by Darren Aronofsky.

programme.title: Birthday Girl
programme.desc: In this scintillating comedy-drama, sparks fly between a lonely English bank teller (Ben Chaplin) and his Russian mail-order bride (Nicole Kidman). At first, he's upset that she doesn't speak English, but soon he discovers that she has other talents. He also learns she has arrived with two mysterious cousins in tow. Vincent Cassel, Mathieu Kassovitz.

programme.title: Disaster Movie
programme.desc: Riotous and outlandish spoof of disaster flicks following a group of attractive young people looking for a safe haven while dodging a deluge of natural and unnatural calamities. Carmen Electra, Matt Lanter. Among the films targeted: \"Iron Man,\" \"The Incredible Hulk,\" \"Hancock,\" \"Enchanted,\" \"Juno,\" \"Sex and the City\" and \"Cloverfield.\" The movie also lampoons pop figures such as Amy Winehouse and Hannah Montana. Produced, written and directed by Jason Friedberg and Aaron Seltzer.

programme.title: The Great Gilly Hopkins
programme.desc: A smart-mouthed 12-year-old girl bounces around between foster homes, causing trouble at each stop with her unruly behavior. A kindhearted woman eventually takes her in and becomes the mother she's never had in this emotional comedy-drama.

programme.title: Planet of the Apes
programme.desc: Director Tim Burton reimagines the 1968 sci-fi classic in this visually stunning feature set in 2029. Mark Wahlberg stars as an astronaut who crash-lands on a planet where dignified apes rule with an iron fist and subservient humans are treated like chattel. Helena Bonham Carter, Tim Roth, Michael Clarke Duncan, Paul Giamatti, Kris Kristofferson, David Warner, Estella Warren.

programme.title: The Cell 2
programme.desc: A psychic investigator attempts to stop a sadistic serial killer who repeatedly brings his helpless victims back to life over and over again until they beg to die. Tessie Santiago stars in this terrifying sequel to the 2000 cult horror movie. Chris Bruno, Frank Whaley, Bart Johnson. Directed by Tim Iacofano.

programme.title: Talk to Me
programme.desc: Don Cheadle's electrifying portrayal of ex-con Petey Greene, who became an influential, controversial disc jockey in 1960s Washington, D.C., as well as a beloved community activist, cues this charged, fact-based biopic. Cheadle perfectly captures Greene's tell-it-like-it-is bluntness and candor. Chiwetel Ejiofor, Taraji P. Henson, Martin Sheen, Mike Epps. Directed by Kasi Lemmons. Features an excellent period soundtrack that includes James Brown, the Dramatics and Otis Redding.

programme.title: Harriet
programme.desc: The incredible true story of one of America's greatest heroes, Harriet Tubman. From her escape from slavery to the dangerous missions she led, setting free hundreds of slaves through the Underground Railroad.

programme.title: Walk the Line
programme.desc: Joaquin Phoenix and Reese Witherspoon give award-winning performances and do their own singing in this touching portrait of music legend Johnny Cash and his tumultuous love affair with June Carter. Ginnifer Goodwin, Robert Patrick, Dallas Roberts. Directed by James Mangold.

programme.title: Epic Movie
programme.desc: From film-spoofmeisters Jason Friedberg and Aaron Seltzer, the guys who co-wrote \"Scary Movie\" and \"Date Movie,\" comes this blisteringly funny parody of blockbuster flicks such as \"The Chronicles of Narnia\" and the \"Harry Potter\" series. Kal Penn stars with Jayma Mays, Crispin Glover, Jennifer Coolidge and Fred Willard. Friedberg and Seltzer both wrote and directed, aiming their barbs at \"Snakes on a Plane,\" \"The Da Vinci Code\" and \"Pirates of the Caribbean.\".

programme.title: Disaster Movie
programme.desc: Riotous and outlandish spoof of disaster flicks following a group of attractive young people looking for a safe haven while dodging a deluge of natural and unnatural calamities. Carmen Electra, Matt Lanter. Among the films targeted: \"Iron Man,\" \"The Incredible Hulk,\" \"Hancock,\" \"Enchanted,\" \"Juno,\" \"Sex and the City\" and \"Cloverfield.\" The movie also lampoons pop figures such as Amy Winehouse and Hannah Montana. Produced, written and directed by Jason Friedberg and Aaron Seltzer.

programme.title: The Iron Lady
programme.desc: Meryl Streep stars in this gripping biopic of influential prime minister Margaret Thatcher, the woman who led the United Kingdom through the 1980s. Directed by Phyllida Lloyd.

programme.title: Sinister
programme.desc: A true-crime novelist moves into a house that was once the site of a multiple murder, and he soon encounters a deadly supernatural entity in this exciting horror tale.

programme.title: Halloween: Resurrection
programme.desc: In the chilling eighth installment of the series, a group of frightened teens tries to live through the night in killer Michael Myers' childhood home as part of an Internet contest set up by an entrepreneur (Busta Rhymes). Little do they know that someone is in the house waiting for them. Jamie Lee Curtis, Ryan Merriman, Bianca Kajlich, Thomas Ian Nicholas.

programme.title: The Untouchables
programme.desc: A Prohibition crime thriller about the battle between gangster Al Capone and federal agent Eliot Ness. Ness and his team of do-gooders set out on a mission to put crime lord Capone out of business.

programme.title: WarGames
programme.desc: A high-school computer whiz unwittingly gains access to the Pentagon's missile-warning system. Innocently, he agrees to a game pitting America against Russia an inadvertently sparks the countdown to World War III.

programme.title: Princess Diana, Freddie and Kenny: 'One Normal Night'
programme.desc: Featuring the story of what happened the night that Freddie Mercury and Kenny Everett put a disguise on their good friend, Princess Diana, and took her out for a night on the town, ending up at the Vauxhall Tavern and encountering a drag queen named Gareth.

programme.title: When Harry Met Sally...
programme.desc: A couple of recent college grads who are opposites go their separate ways. However, as they repeatedly run into each other over the years, they are able to maintain a close friendship by keeping sex out of it for fear it might ruin their relationship.

programme.title: Enduring Love
programme.desc: In a haunting exploration of obsession, a university professor (Daniel Craig) finds himself being stalked by a religious fanatic he met during a bizarre hot-air balloon accident. Roger Michell (\"Changing Lanes\") directed this gripping thriller. Rhys Ifans, Samantha Morton, Bill Nighy, Susan Lynch.

programme.title: Hotel Rwanda
programme.desc: Don Cheadle's Oscar-nominated turn drives this searing drama set during the Hutu-Tutsi civil war in Rwanda. Cheadle plays hotel manager Paul Rusesabagina, who tries to save the lives of more than a thousand Tutsi refugees by hiding them in his hotel. Terry George directed and co-wrote. The strong cast also includes Nick Nolte, Joaquin Phoenix and Best Supporting Actress nominee Sophie Okonedo.

programme.title: Out of Time
programme.desc: Denzel Washington is reunited with his \"Devil in a Blue Dress\" director, Carl Franklin, for this smart and steamy thriller. He plays a small-town Florida police chief who's been framed for murder and is racing against the clock to find the real killer.

programme.title: The Silence of the Lambs
programme.desc: Best Picture winner about an FBI trainee (Best Actress Jodie Foster), who has a knack for analyzing serial killers, and enlists the aid of an imprisoned, cannibalistic sociopath (Best Actor Anthony Hopkins) in tracking a sadistic murderer. An Oscar went to director Jonathan Demme and also Ted Tally won for Best Adapted Screenplay for his script based on the Thomas Harris novel.

programme.title: Carrie
programme.desc: A shy teenager, dominated by a religiously fanatic mother, suffers at the hands of high-school bullies, whose mean pranks rile the teen into discovering she has telekinetic powers, which she uses to take ultimate revenge at the prom.

programme.title: When Harry Met Sally...
programme.desc: A couple of recent college grads who are opposites go their separate ways. However, as they repeatedly run into each other over the years, they are able to maintain a close friendship by keeping sex out of it for fear it might ruin their relationship.

programme.title: Uptown Girls
programme.desc: Brittany Murphy and young Dakota Fanning are delightful together in this charming comedy. Murphy plays the privileged daughter of a late rock star who loses her inheritance and must go to work as a nanny to a precocious 8-year-old.

programme.title: Strictly Ballroom
programme.desc: Dynamic choreography enhances this story of a rebellious dancer (Paul Mercurio), his novice partner (Tara Morice) and a prestigious competition. Fife: Bill Hunter. Hastings: Barry Otto. Shirley: Pat Thompson. Liz: Gia Carides. Kendall: Peter Whitford. Railings: John Hannan. Directed and co-written by Baz Luhrmann.

programme.title: CB4
programme.desc: A trio of failed musicians pose as ex-convicts turned hip-hop artists. As they rise to fame, turmoil brews within and a real ex-con seeks them out.

programme.title: The Cold Light of Day
programme.desc: A hotshot stockbroker must save his family after they are kidnapped during a vacation in Spain. In order to do so, he will need to learn dark secrets from his father's past and uncover a government conspiracy.

programme.title: The Caveman's Valentine
programme.desc: Samuel L. Jackson wears several hats in this tense drama about a Juilliard-trained pianist who suffers from schizophrenia and lives in a cave. He suspects that a young homeless man's death was actually a murder, but can't get anyone to believe him. Ann Magnuson, Colm Feore, Aunjanue Ellis, Tamara Tunie, Jay Rodan, Anthony Michael Hall.

programme.title: Reefer Madness
programme.desc: A vintage propaganda film in purporting to depict the \"ghastly menace\" of marijuana, which has gained newfound life as a camp classic.

programme.title: Hotel Rwanda
programme.desc: Don Cheadle's Oscar-nominated turn drives this searing drama set during the Hutu-Tutsi civil war in Rwanda. Cheadle plays hotel manager Paul Rusesabagina, who tries to save the lives of more than a thousand Tutsi refugees by hiding them in his hotel. Terry George directed and co-wrote. The strong cast also includes Nick Nolte, Joaquin Phoenix and Best Supporting Actress nominee Sophie Okonedo.

programme.title: Winter Solstice
programme.desc: Anthony LaPaglia is superb as a grieving widower who struggles to deal with his youngest son's self-destructive behavior and his oldest son's decision to leave home. Josh Sternfeld wrote and directed this poignant family drama. Aaron Stanford, Mark Webber, Allison Janney.

programme.title: Falling for Grace
programme.desc: Modern-day take on Cinderella follows an ambitious young banker (Fay Ann Lee, who also directed and cowrote the script) who is mistaken for an heiress at a posh society affair, where she meets and falls for a successful lawyer (Gale Harold). Christine Baranski, Ken Leung. Also known as \"East Broadway.\".

programme.title: The Truth About Cats & Dogs
programme.desc: In this amusing variation on the Cyrano de Bergerac story, an insecure radio talk-show host (Janeane Garofalo) conceals her looks by switching identities with a gorgeous model to win the man of her dreams.

programme.title: Reality Bites
programme.desc: A Gen X-er documents the lives of herself and her contemporaries as they face life after college.

programme.title: Hollywoodland
programme.desc: \"L.A. Confidential\" meets \"Chinatown\" in this involving and masterfully realized crime thriller. Adrien Brody gives a compelling performance as a glory-seeking gumshoe hired to investigate the suspicious 1959 death of actor George Reeves (Ben Affleck), who played Superman on TV. His probe turns up some big names who will do anything to stay out of the tawdry Tinseltown case. Diane Lane, Bob Hoskins, Joe Spano, Lois Smith, Robin Tunney, Ted Atherton. Directed by Allen Coulter.

programme.title: My Week With Marilyn
programme.desc: In this poignant examination of stardom, a 23-year-old is hired to chauffeur Marilyn Monroe (Michelle Williams) for one week during the shooting of \"The Prince and the Showgirl,\" affording the young man a glimpse at the sadness behind her Hollywood persona. Based on the memoirs of British filmmaker Colin Clark.

programme.title: Margot at the Wedding
programme.desc: A cynical writer travels home to reconcile with her estranged, free-spirited sister, who is about to get married. Nicole Kidman and Jennifer Jason Leigh give superb performances in this incisive dramedy of family dysfunction. Written and directed by Noah Baumbach.

programme.title: The Truth About Cats & Dogs
programme.desc: In this amusing variation on the Cyrano de Bergerac story, an insecure radio talk-show host (Janeane Garofalo) conceals her looks by switching identities with a gorgeous model to win the man of her dreams.

programme.title: Reality Bites
programme.desc: A Gen X-er documents the lives of herself and her contemporaries as they face life after college.

programme.title: Perfect Sense
programme.desc: Lovelorn epidemiologist Susan (Eva Green) falls for a chef (Ewan McGregor) while at the same time investigating a global disorder that is causing people to lose their five senses after they experience emotional upheavals.

programme.title: The Machinist
programme.desc: Christian Bale is brilliant in this riveting psychological thriller about the mental and physical deterioration of a factory worker who hasn't slept for a year. Things get really eerie when he begins having visions of a co-worker nobody else can see. Jennifer Jason Leigh, Aitana Sanchez-Gijon, John Sharian. Directed by Brad Anderson.

programme.title: Zombie
programme.desc: Walking dead on the loose in New York City. Tisa Farrow, Ian McCulloch, Richard Johnson. Brian: Al Cliver. Susan: Arnetta Gay. Lucio Fulci directed.

programme.title: Schultze Gets the Blues
programme.desc: Cultures clash in this tuneful and amiable character study that follows a music-loving retiree (Horst Krause), a German accordion player, who undertakes a road trip to Louisiana after he becomes enamored with zydeco music. Written and directed by Michael Schorr. Harald Warmbrunn, Karl-Fred Muller, Ursula Schucht, Hannelore Schubert.

programme.title: Mick & Margaret (?)
programme.desc: A comedy about the friendship between Mick Jagger and Princess Margaret.

programme.title: Coach Carter
programme.desc: Samuel L. Jackson brings his A-game to this inspiring and eloquent fact-based sports drama. He plays a no-nonsense California high-school basketball coach who demands that his cocky, undisciplined players be responsible on and off the court. Rob Brown, Robert Ri'chard, Debbi Morgan, Ashanti, Rick Gonzalez, Antwon Tanner, Nana Gbewonyo, Denise Dowse, Mel Winkler.

programme.title: Critical Condition
programme.desc: Richard Pryor as a con man who avoids jail by impersonating a doctor. Rachel: Rachel Ticotin. Louis: Ruben Blades. Foster: Bob Dishy. Chambers: Joe Mantegna. Stucky: Joe Dallesandro. Maggie: Sylvia Miles.

programme.title: WarGames
programme.desc: A high-school computer whiz unwittingly gains access to the Pentagon's missile-warning system. Innocently, he agrees to a game pitting America against Russia an inadvertently sparks the countdown to World War III.

programme.title: Tammy and the Teenage T-Rex
programme.desc: A high-schooler's brain is transplanted into a mechanical dinosaur. Terry Kiser, Paul Walker, Denise Richards.

programme.title: Blow Out
programme.desc: While recording late-night sound effects, an engineer becomes an \"ear-witness\" to a political assassination.

programme.title: The Conversation
programme.desc: Character study of Harry Caul, an expert wiretapper assigned to surveil a couple in San Francisco. As he learns more about the couple through conversation, Harry wrestles with the notion that his recording could lead to their murder.

programme.title: Croupier
programme.desc: Mike Hodges, director of 1971's \"Get Carter\" with Michael Caine, gambled and won with this acclaimed caper film. Clive Owen stars as Jack Manfred, a struggling author and London casino worker. Jack rolls the dice with a seductress (Alex Kingston), whose associates plan to rip off his employers. Gina McKee, Kate Hardie, Nicholas Ball.

programme.title: The Express
programme.desc: Rob Brown gives a stellar performance in this winning fact-based sports biopic. He plays Syracuse University running back Ernie Davis, the first African-American to win the Heisman Trophy as the outstanding college-football player in the nation in 1961. Dennis Quaid costars as Syracuse coach Ben Schwartzwalder. Directed by Gary Fleder. The screenplay is by Charles Leavitt, who based it on the book \"Ernie Davis: The Elmira Express,\" written by Syracuse alumnus Robert C. Gallagher.

programme.title: Coach Carter
programme.desc: Samuel L. Jackson brings his A-game to this inspiring and eloquent fact-based sports drama. He plays a no-nonsense California high-school basketball coach who demands that his cocky, undisciplined players be responsible on and off the court. Rob Brown, Robert Ri'chard, Debbi Morgan, Ashanti, Rick Gonzalez, Antwon Tanner, Nana Gbewonyo, Denise Dowse, Mel Winkler.

programme.title: The Nevers
programme.desc: In 1899 London, Amalia True and Penance Adair work to protect their kind from widespread, deepening antipathy, three years after an inexplicable event suddenly equipped them with extraordinary abilities. Meanwhile, police inspector Frank Mundi investigates a string of murders at the hands of a reportedly Touched and highly dangerous serial killer named Maladie. Series premiere.

programme.title: Last Week Tonight With John Oliver
programme.sub-title: Last Week Tonight with John Oliver 217

programme.title: The Nevers
programme.desc: In 1899 London, Amalia True and Penance Adair work to protect their kind from widespread, deepening antipathy, three years after an inexplicable event suddenly equipped them with extraordinary abilities. Meanwhile, police inspector Frank Mundi investigates a string of murders at the hands of a reportedly Touched and highly dangerous serial killer named Maladie. Series premiere.

programme.title: Last Week Tonight With John Oliver
programme.sub-title: Last Week Tonight with John Oliver 217

programme.title: Hardball
programme.desc: In this heartwarming sports drama, Keanu Reeves plays a ne'er-do-well gambler who learns something about the game of life when he agrees to coach an inner-city Chicago Little League team. Talented kid actors pitch in to provide solid relief. Diane Lane, John Hawkes, DeWayne Warren, Michael Jordan, Michael Perkins, Julian Griffith, Bryan C. Hearne, A. Delon Ellis Jr., Brian M. Reed.

programme.title: Last Week Tonight With John Oliver
programme.sub-title: Last Week Tonight with John Oliver 217

programme.title: Spy Game
programme.desc: Director Tony Scott puts golden boys Robert Redford and Brad Pitt through their paces in this fast-paced espionage thriller. Redford plays a CIA operative who spends his final day at the agency trying to coordinate the rescue of his protégé (Pitt), who's being held in a Chinese prison---and hung out to dry by his superiors. Catherine McCormack, Marianne Jean-Baptiste.

programme.title: Wendy
programme.desc: A soft-spoken Louisiana girl journeys to an exciting, ethereal and tropical island jungle called Neverland where children never grow old. However, her whimsical, carefree behavior is soon marred by the realization of what happens when mortality descends on the young.

programme.title: Last Week Tonight With John Oliver
programme.sub-title: Last Week Tonight with John Oliver 217

programme.title: My Super Ex-Girlfriend
programme.desc: In this high-flying comedy, Uma Thurman gives a superb performance as a shrewish, possessive superhero who gets dumped by her regular-Joe boyfriend (Luke Wilson), and then decides to use her superpowers to exact revenge on him and his new love (Anna Faris). In a hilarious nod to \"Fatal Attraction,\" Thurman substitutes live great-white-shark sushi for the boiled bunny. Directed by Ivan Reitman and written by Don Payne, who has scripted episodes of \"The Simpsons.\".

programme.title: The Namesake
programme.desc: A Bengali family tries to acclimate to life in the U.S. in this poignant and bittersweet saga of cultures clashing across generations. Their teenage son (Kal Penn) does not embrace their Indian heritage until he visits Calcutta, where he gains an understanding of the importance of his family's past. Indian-born Mira Nair directed from a script by Sooni Taraporevala, who adapted Pulitzer Prize-winner Jhumpa Lahiri's novel. Bollywood superstar Tabu costars as Penn's old-world mother.

programme.title: Black Christmas
programme.desc: During Christmas break, a group of female students realizes someone is watching their every move. While pledging for a sorority, they realize that their stalker is a murderer operating out of a secret society in their college's shady underbelly. The girls then decide to take matters into their own hands in order to rid themselves of this presence once and for all.

programme.title: The Lucky One
programme.desc: In this unforgettable tale of romance, Iraq War veteran Logan Thibault tracks down a woman from a photo that he credits with keeping him alive during three tours of duty, and he begins to suspect that she is the love of his life.

programme.title: Lars and the Real Girl
programme.desc: Ryan Gosling gives a bravura performance as a lonely, delusional young man named Lars who surprises his family when he shows up with a new love, a life-size doll he names Bianca and treats like an actual girlfriend. Things take an even quirkier turn when Lars' psychiatrist (Patricia Clarkson) tells his family and friends to humor him and go along with the situation. An offbeat and touching comedy-drama directed by Craig Gillespie and written by Nancy Oliver. Emily Mortimer, Paul Schneider.

programme.title: Last Week Tonight With John Oliver
programme.sub-title: Last Week Tonight with John Oliver 217

programme.title: The Nevers
programme.desc: In 1899 London, Amalia True and Penance Adair work to protect their kind from widespread, deepening antipathy, three years after an inexplicable event suddenly equipped them with extraordinary abilities. Meanwhile, police inspector Frank Mundi investigates a string of murders at the hands of a reportedly Touched and highly dangerous serial killer named Maladie. Series premiere.

programme.title: Wanderlust
programme.desc: In this hilarious comedy, an unemployed Manhattan businessman and his wife move into a seemingly idyllic, clothing-optional hippie commune called Elysium, which may cause more problems in their marriage than it solves.

programme.title: Pray, Obey, Kill
programme.desc: Series premiere. A five-part documentary revisits a complex Swedish murder case from 2004 that gained global attention. On a cold night in January, gunshots rang out across the remote Swedish village Knutby, home to a small, tight-knit Pentecostal congregation, leaving a young woman murdered in her bed and her neighbor suffering from multiple bullet wounds.

programme.title: The Nevers
programme.desc: In 1899 London, Amalia True and Penance Adair work to protect their kind from widespread, deepening antipathy, three years after an inexplicable event suddenly equipped them with extraordinary abilities. Meanwhile, police inspector Frank Mundi investigates a string of murders at the hands of a reportedly Touched and highly dangerous serial killer named Maladie. Series premiere.

programme.title: Pray, Obey, Kill
programme.desc: Series premiere. A five-part documentary revisits a complex Swedish murder case from 2004 that gained global attention. On a cold night in January, gunshots rang out across the remote Swedish village Knutby, home to a small, tight-knit Pentecostal congregation, leaving a young woman murdered in her bed and her neighbor suffering from multiple bullet wounds.

programme.title: The Watch
programme.desc: Four suburbanites stumble upon an alien invasion while volunteering as a neighborhood-watch group, and they fight to protect their block from evil extraterrestrials in this madcap sci-fi comedy.

programme.title: Shaun of the Dead
programme.desc: Yuks and yucks collide in this uproarious British comedy, a seamless blend of wit and horror. Simon Pegg stars as a beer-swilling slacker who tries to get his miserable life in order while repelling the zombies that have overrun London. Pegg also co-wrote the script with director Edgar Wright. Kate Ashfield, Nick Frost, Lucy Davis, Bill Nighy, Martin Freeman.

programme.title: Dirty Dancing
programme.desc: An innocent teen vacationing with her upper-middle-class parents at an upscale resort in the 1960s Catskills gets a jolt of culture shock when she crushes on the hotel's slick, handsome dance instructor. The soundtrack yielded the Oscar-winning Best Song \"(I've Had the) Time of My Life.\".

programme.title: The Pacifier
programme.desc: An outrageous romp about a Navy SEAL who's assigned to protect the wife of a government employee and her five unruly kids.

programme.title: The Family Man
programme.desc: Nicolas Cage discovers that it's a wonderful life in this touching comic fantasy. He plays a rich, ruthless businessman who's shown the life he might have had by a guardian angel (Don Cheadle) who transforms him into a suburban working stiff with a wife (Tea Leoni), kids and minivan. Brett Ratner directed. Jeremy Piven, Saul Rubinek, Josef Sommer, Makenzie Vega.

programme.title: Drumline
programme.desc: Energetic drama about a hotshot New York City percussionist who adjusts to the demands of a big-time college marching band while trying to fit in at the prestigious Atlanta university.

programme.title: Independence Day
programme.desc: An army of alien spaceships attack Earth and threaten to destroy the human race, but a handful of survivors band together to stop the invasion.

programme.title: Exterminate All the Brutes
programme.sub-title: Part 1: The Disturbing Confidence of Ignorance
programme.desc: Filmmaker Raoul Peck examines the intertwined currents of hate and bigotry running through history. Focusing on the United States' legacy as a colonial power, Peck explores how race first became institutionalized, the Nazi program of \"elimination\" and its antecedents in the West, and the looting of the African continent in a \"gentlemen's agreement.\" Series premiere.

programme.title: Exterminate All the Brutes
programme.sub-title: Part 2: Who the F*** Is Columbus
programme.desc: Revisiting the stories of Christopher Columbus, the Alamo and the Trail of Tears from an indigenous perspective, Raoul Peck shows how \"official\" history is shaped by those in power and solidified by myth and popular culture. Later, he examines the \"doctrine of discovery\" used to justify the enslavement of millions of Africans and questions his own story within these narratives.

programme.title: Real Time With Bill Maher
programme.sub-title: Alex Padilla; Heather McGhee; Reihan Salam
programme.desc: Sen. Alex Padilla (D-Cal.) is the interview guest. The panelists are economic equality advocate Heather McGhee and political commentator Reihan Salam.

programme.title: Midway
programme.desc: In 1942, a few months after the infamous Pearl Harbor attack and a few years before World War II ended, the Japanese forces were once again planning to stage a sudden attack against their opponents this time near the Midway Atoll. Their plan, however, was intercepted, and the American forces arrived at the Pacific Ocean theater just in time to stop them. The battle lasted for three days, and its outcome became a critical turning point in the ongoing war.

programme.title: Our Towns
programme.desc: A documentary that paints a remarkable picture of America and how the rise of civic and economic reinvention is transforming small cities and towns across the country.

programme.title: The Nevers
programme.desc: In 1899 London, Amalia True and Penance Adair work to protect their kind from widespread, deepening antipathy, three years after an inexplicable event suddenly equipped them with extraordinary abilities. Meanwhile, police inspector Frank Mundi investigates a string of murders at the hands of a reportedly Touched and highly dangerous serial killer named Maladie. Series premiere.

programme.title: Up in the Air
programme.desc: This warmhearted dramedy centers on Ryan Bingham, who works for a company that specializes in firing people. Ryan is soon forced to take a newcomer along on a business trip in order to show her firsthand what he does, and he begins to reflect on his lonely life and develops a relationship with fellow frequent flyer Alex Goran.

programme.title: He Got Game
programme.desc: Spike Lee's moving story centers on a killer (Denzel Washington) who is granted a temporary leave from prison to persuade his son (NBA star Ray Allen, in his big-screen debut), a talented young basketball player, to attend the governor's alma mater. Milla Jovovich, Rosario Dawson, Hill Harper.

programme.title: A Storybook Ending
programme.desc: In this neo-noir dark comedy short, a chain reaction of blackmail and murder is set off after a Black man accidentally kills an undercover cop in self-defense.

programme.title: Timeline
programme.desc: Richard Donner directed this thrilling adaptation of Michael Crichton's novel about a team of modern-day archaeological students trying to rescue their mentor (Billy Connolly) from 14th-century France. Paul Walker, Frances O'Connor, Gerard Butler, David Thewlis, Anna Friel, Neal McDonough, Michael Sheen, Lambert Wilson, Matt Craven, Ethan Embry.

programme.title: Speed 2: Cruise Control
programme.desc: Sandra Bullock returns as Annie, the spunky heroine from \"Speed,\" as she joins her new beau, Alex (Jason Patric), on an ocean liner. Unfortunately, also aboard is a madman who takes control of the ship and threatens to sink her in a plot to steal millions in jewels and seek revenge for his devastating illness. Willem Dafoe, Temuera Morrison, Brian McCardie.

programme.title: Cats
programme.desc: A tribe of unruly and anthropomorphic city cats, the Jellicles, approach their yearly ceremony. The tribe must elect one of their ranks to venture to the Heaviside Layer and reincarnate as a new life in the Jellicle tribe. Based on the poetry collection by T.S. Eliot.

programme.title: Hardball
programme.desc: In this heartwarming sports drama, Keanu Reeves plays a ne'er-do-well gambler who learns something about the game of life when he agrees to coach an inner-city Chicago Little League team. Talented kid actors pitch in to provide solid relief. Diane Lane, John Hawkes, DeWayne Warren, Michael Jordan, Michael Perkins, Julian Griffith, Bryan C. Hearne, A. Delon Ellis Jr., Brian M. Reed.

programme.title: The Fast and the Furious
programme.desc: Buckle up for a wild ride as Paul Walker (\"Joy Ride\") and Vin Diesel (\"Pitch Black\") put the pedal to the metal in this high-octane action thriller. Diesel plays the leader of a gang of L.A. street racers who moonlight in highway robbery; Walker is the undercover cop who befriends him. Michelle Rodriguez, Jordana Brewster, Rick Yune, Chad Lindberg.

programme.title: True Grit
programme.desc: In the Coen brothers' stirring remake of the John Wayne classic, an alcoholic U.S. Marshal and an independent-minded 14-year-old girl track down her father's killer with the help of a Texas Ranger. As the three brave dangerous Indian territory, they discover their prey has fallen in with a more-experienced criminal.

programme.title: Tina
programme.desc: This documentary provides an intimate look at the life and career of iconic American-born singer Tina Turner. It explores her early life in Brownsville, Tennessee, her unexpected rise to fame in the 1960s, the upheavals in her personal and professional life, and her unexpected career resurgence and superstardom in the 1980s.

programme.title: Dark Shadows
programme.desc: Entombed for 200 years after betraying a witch, 18th-century vampire Barnabas Collins returns to his mansion in 1972, only to find his estate in ruins and his family plagued by macabre secrets in this deliciously gothic remake of the classic TV series.

programme.title: The Nevers
programme.desc: In 1899 London, Amalia True and Penance Adair work to protect their kind from widespread, deepening antipathy, three years after an inexplicable event suddenly equipped them with extraordinary abilities. Meanwhile, police inspector Frank Mundi investigates a string of murders at the hands of a reportedly Touched and highly dangerous serial killer named Maladie. Series premiere.

programme.title: The New Mutants
programme.desc: When Illyana, Rahne, Sam, Danielle, and Roberto — five teenage mutants who are just discovering their superhuman abilities — are held inside an isolated hospital to be psychologically monitored, strange occurrences begin to happen. As events intensify, they find themselves embarking on a mission to escape the facility and save their lives, putting their newfound friendship and powers to the ultimate test.

programme.title: Pray, Obey, Kill
programme.desc: Series premiere. A five-part documentary revisits a complex Swedish murder case from 2004 that gained global attention. On a cold night in January, gunshots rang out across the remote Swedish village Knutby, home to a small, tight-knit Pentecostal congregation, leaving a young woman murdered in her bed and her neighbor suffering from multiple bullet wounds.

programme.title: Phantom Thread
programme.desc: In this stunning period drama set in 1950s London, a meticulous tailor for the rich and famous suddenly finds himself in love with a working-class woman. Their worlds collide as the tailor's obsession with her begins to disturb his professional life.

programme.title: The Brothers Grimm
programme.desc: In Terry Gilliam's inventive fantasy, the famed authors are cast as con artists who get caught up in a real-life fairy tale involving a haunted forest where girls have been disappearing. Matt Damon and Heath Ledger star in this whimsical adventure. Jonathan Pryce, Monica Bellucci, Peter Stormare, Lena Headey.

programme.title: Wolves at the Door
programme.desc: In 1969, four friends throwing a farewell party find themselves hunted by mysterious strangers outside their house.

programme.title: White Noise
programme.desc: Michael Keaton's haunting performance guides this spine-tingling thriller about an architect who becomes consumed with contacting his dead wife's spirit through electronic devices. Chandra West, Deborah Kara Unger, Ian McNeice, Sarah Strange.

programme.title: Rollerball (?)
programme.desc: In this slam-bang remake set in 2005, Chris Klein subs for James Caan, who starred in the original 1975 sci-fi actioner, as a star player in a violent international pastime that is a frenetic mix of roller derby, basketball, hockey and football, as well as multiple extreme sports.

programme.title: Bowfinger
programme.desc: Steve Martin wrote and stars in a winning satire of the film industry. Martin plays Bobby Bowfinger, a penniless producer who wants to make a movie with action star Kit Ramsey (Eddie Murphy). He just doesn't want Kit to realize he's being filmed. Murphy also stars as Jiff Ramsey, Kit's nerdy brother, whom Bowfinger enlists to fill in for Kit. Heather Graham, Christine Baranski, Jamie Kennedy.

programme.title: Death Becomes Her
programme.desc: Two youth-obsessed rivals turn to an immortality treatment in their never-ending quest to outdo each other.

programme.title: Hacksaw Ridge
programme.desc: Riveting biopic about World War II Army medic Desmond Doss, a conscientious objector who refused to take a life or even carry a weapon. Doss was eventually awarded the Medal of Honor for saving the lives of 75 soldiers on the battlefields of Okinawa.

programme.title: The Five-Year Engagement
programme.desc: A couple named Tom and Violet find their wedding plans interrupted by a number of surprises over the course of five years in this endearing romantic comedy, as Violet must move to Michigan for school and Tom is frustrated by missed job opportunities.

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: The Crawley family prepares for an official royal visit to their family house in Yorkshire in 1927. They experience physical, social, and psychological upheavals as King George V, Queen Mary, and their royal entourage descend on the eponymous mansion.

programme.title: The King of Staten Island
programme.desc: Struggling since his father died during his childhood, twenty-something Scott squanders his life on drugs, alcohol, and casual hookups. When his mother brings home a churlish new boyfriend, Scott must face his demons head-on in order to overcome.

programme.title: Tina
programme.desc: This documentary provides an intimate look at the life and career of iconic American-born singer Tina Turner. It explores her early life in Brownsville, Tennessee, her unexpected rise to fame in the 1960s, the upheavals in her personal and professional life, and her unexpected career resurgence and superstardom in the 1980s.

programme.title: Dead Silence
programme.desc: When a man (Ryan Kwanten) suspected of his wife's brutal murder tells a detective (Donnie Wahlberg) he believes she was killed by a late ventriloquist's doll, all he gets is lip service---until more bodies start turning up. This crafty chiller's screenwriter (Leigh Whannell) and director (James Wan) are the team behind the \"Saw\" series. The film is in the scary tradition of such demon-dummy villains as \"Dead of Night,\" \"Magic\" and \"Devil Doll.\" Amber Valletta, Bob Gunton.

programme.title: Assault on Precinct 13
programme.desc: Gritty action fires up this intense crime drama. On New Year's Eve inside a Detroit police station, an officer (Ethan Hawke) must round up a makeshift brigade of cops and criminals when the precinct is besieged by a relentless mob. The film is an effective refashioning of the 1976 film of the same name. Laurence Fishburne, Drea de Matteo, Brian Dennehy, John Leguizamo.

programme.title: Speed 2: Cruise Control
programme.desc: Sandra Bullock returns as Annie, the spunky heroine from \"Speed,\" as she joins her new beau, Alex (Jason Patric), on an ocean liner. Unfortunately, also aboard is a madman who takes control of the ship and threatens to sink her in a plot to steal millions in jewels and seek revenge for his devastating illness. Willem Dafoe, Temuera Morrison, Brian McCardie.

programme.title: Pray, Obey, Kill
programme.desc: Series premiere. A five-part documentary revisits a complex Swedish murder case from 2004 that gained global attention. On a cold night in January, gunshots rang out across the remote Swedish village Knutby, home to a small, tight-knit Pentecostal congregation, leaving a young woman murdered in her bed and her neighbor suffering from multiple bullet wounds.

programme.title: Jaws
programme.desc: An enormous great white shark terrorizes a summer resort town, where a police chief, a grizzled fisherman and an intrepid marine biologist realize they're \"gonna need a bigger boat\" to battle the bloodthirsty beast. An Oscar winner for sound, editing and John Williams' score.

programme.title: Billy Madison
programme.desc: A spoiled heir must repeat grades one through 12 within six months to inherit his family's hotel business.

programme.title: Bandits
programme.desc: Bruce Willis and Billy Bob Thornton are delightful as thieves who hold a bank manager hostage the night before a heist, then empty the vault before the start of business the next day---known as the \"Sleepover Bandits.\" Barry Levinson directed the sly comedy-drama. Cate Blanchett, Troy Garity.

programme.title: The Banger Sisters
programme.desc: Goldie Hawn and Susan Sarandon star in this giddy comedy about former rock groupies who reunite decades after their wild antics. Hawn plays the freewheeling Suzette, who is shocked to find her pal Lavinia (Sarandon) is a proper housewife living in suburbia. Geoffrey Rush, Erika Christensen, Eva Amurri, Robin Thomas.

programme.title: The Cypher
programme.desc: With his reputation and record deal on the line, Khalil confronts his opponent Yung Reap and defends his secret during a freestyle rap competition in Philadelphia.

programme.title: Walk of Shame
programme.desc: In this hilariously raunchy comedy, an aspiring reporter races to an important job interview following a one-night stand that leaves her stranded in downtown Los Angeles. To make matters worse, she's been left without a phone, car, money or ID.

programme.title: Pray, Obey, Kill
programme.desc: Series premiere. A five-part documentary revisits a complex Swedish murder case from 2004 that gained global attention. On a cold night in January, gunshots rang out across the remote Swedish village Knutby, home to a small, tight-knit Pentecostal congregation, leaving a young woman murdered in her bed and her neighbor suffering from multiple bullet wounds.

programme.title: Doctor Dolittle (?)
programme.desc: A famous San Francisco doctor suddenly regains his childhood ability to communicate with animals. Soon his medical practice is flooded with a stampede of wisecracking four-legged patients, just in time to help him fend off a takeover attempt by an HMO.

programme.title: Ted
programme.desc: In this quirky comedy, a child successfully wishes that his teddy bear could come to life, but he gets more than he bargained for when the stuffed animal follows him into adulthood and complicates his relationship with a beautiful woman.

programme.title: The Last Cruise (?)
programme.desc: Chronicling the first and largest outbreak of the COVID-19 coronavirus outside China: The Diamond Princess cruise liner.

programme.title: The Nevers
programme.desc: In 1899 London, Amalia True and Penance Adair work to protect their kind from widespread, deepening antipathy, three years after an inexplicable event suddenly equipped them with extraordinary abilities. Meanwhile, police inspector Frank Mundi investigates a string of murders at the hands of a reportedly Touched and highly dangerous serial killer named Maladie. Series premiere.

programme.title: Last Week Tonight With John Oliver
programme.sub-title: Last Week Tonight with John Oliver 217

programme.title: Battleship
programme.desc: After aliens attack a U.S. Navy fleet during a training exercise, an untested lieutenant is forced to take command and fight back against the extraterrestrial invaders in this exhilarating action flick based on the popular board game.

programme.title: Exterminate All the Brutes
programme.sub-title: Part 1: The Disturbing Confidence of Ignorance
programme.desc: Filmmaker Raoul Peck examines the intertwined currents of hate and bigotry running through history. Focusing on the United States' legacy as a colonial power, Peck explores how race first became institutionalized, the Nazi program of \"elimination\" and its antecedents in the West, and the looting of the African continent in a \"gentlemen's agreement.\" Series premiere.

programme.title: Exterminate All the Brutes
programme.sub-title: Part 2: Who the F*** Is Columbus
programme.desc: Revisiting the stories of Christopher Columbus, the Alamo and the Trail of Tears from an indigenous perspective, Raoul Peck shows how \"official\" history is shaped by those in power and solidified by myth and popular culture. Later, he examines the \"doctrine of discovery\" used to justify the enslavement of millions of Africans and questions his own story within these narratives.

programme.title: A Kiss Before Dying
programme.desc: A schemer marries into a wealthy family. However, his bride suspects he is the man responsible for his sister's death.

programme.title: Real Sports With Bryant Gumbel
programme.sub-title: Real Sports With Bryant Gumbel Xxxx21 - #287
programme.desc: An award-winning monthly sports journalism series with investigative pieces and in-depth profiles from across the sports spectrum.

programme.title: Lowriders
programme.desc: In this stylish urban drama, a young street artist finds himself torn between the lowrider car culture of his father and his desire for a creative outlet. This generational clash is further complicated when his older brother returns home from prison.

programme.title: Barefoot
programme.desc: In this delightful, feel-good romance, a wealthy playboy falls for a sheltered beauty who charms his family at his brother's lavish wedding. Suddenly, the man whose life was going nowhere seems to have found the road to true happiness.

programme.title: Pitch Perfect
programme.desc: The laughs never stop as a feisty college student gives her school's a cappella group a much-needed makeover by adding some modern hits into the mix during the run-up to a big competition.

programme.title: Win a Date With Tad Hamilton!
programme.desc: Robert Luketic (\"Legally Blonde\") directed this cheery comedy about a self-centered movie star (Josh Duhamel) who tries to repair his bad-boy image by dating a naive fan (Kate Bosworth). No one is more surprised than the star when he begins to fall for the small-town girl. Nathan Lane, Sean Hayes, Gary Cole.

programme.title: School of Rock
programme.desc: Jack Black earned a Golden Globe nomination for his inspired performance in Richard Linklater's whimsical comedy. He plays a manic slacker-turned-substitute teacher who transforms his sheltered private-school pupils into a full-fledged rock band.

programme.title: The Beguiled
programme.desc: In this captivating, erotically charged Civil War drama, a deserter from the Union Army seeks refuge at an all-female boarding school in Virginia, where the ladies compete for his affections while tending to his injuries. His presence at the school slowly poisons the relationships between the various women, who eventually turn on the soldier.

programme.title: Going in Style
programme.desc: Three elderly friends and retired steelworkers are outraged to learn that their pension fund has been raided by a shady corporation. Soon, they decide to rob one of the corporation's banks to get their money back in this rousing crime comedy.

programme.title: Tower Heist
programme.desc: An NYC condo manager (Ben Stiller) and his staff plot to rob the penthouse of a thieving Wall Street billionaire who defrauded them out of their savings in this hysterical crime comedy. But they'll need the help of a crafty thief to execute the heist.

programme.title: Pray, Obey, Kill
programme.desc: Series premiere. A five-part documentary revisits a complex Swedish murder case from 2004 that gained global attention. On a cold night in January, gunshots rang out across the remote Swedish village Knutby, home to a small, tight-knit Pentecostal congregation, leaving a young woman murdered in her bed and her neighbor suffering from multiple bullet wounds.

programme.title: Our Towns
programme.desc: A documentary that paints a remarkable picture of America and how the rise of civic and economic reinvention is transforming small cities and towns across the country.

programme.title: The Nevers
programme.desc: In 1899 London, Amalia True and Penance Adair work to protect their kind from widespread, deepening antipathy, three years after an inexplicable event suddenly equipped them with extraordinary abilities. Meanwhile, police inspector Frank Mundi investigates a string of murders at the hands of a reportedly Touched and highly dangerous serial killer named Maladie. Series premiere.

programme.title: Endings, Beginnings
programme.desc: Daphne is a woman in her thirties who recently broke up with her boyfriend. As she's trying to recover and heal, she is having second thoughts about long-term love. These thoughts are challenged when she meets two men who are attracted to her: one is a sensitive and intelligent academic while the other is a free-spirited bad boy type. Her next challenge to choose between the two.

programme.title: Confessions of a Dangerous Mind
programme.desc: George Clooney made his directorial debut with this wry, tongue-in-cheek drama about Chuck Barris (Sam Rockwell), the game-show host from the '60s and '70s who claims that his flamboyant career was a cover for his double life...as a CIA assassin. Screenwriter Charlie Kaufman adapted Barris's \"unauthorized autobiography.\" Drew Barrymore, Julia Roberts, George Clooney, Maggie Gyllenhaal.

programme.title: Galveston
programme.desc: A fading hitman knows he is living on borrowed time after a set up nearly costs his life. Now presented with the difficulty of protecting not only himself but newly-befriended prostitute Raquel, his home town of Galveston is the setting for retribution and a dangerously uncertain fate.

programme.title: The Hills Have Eyes
programme.desc: One of the all-time great horror classics (from 1977) undergoes a frighteningly good reworking. The hills are alive with the sound of terror as a family of vacationers tangle with a clan of psycho mutants in the New Mexico desert.

programme.title: Love Field
programme.desc: A housewife befriends a black man who has kidnapped his daughter from an orphanage. They meet on a bus trip where she is planning on going to Washington D.C. in order to be with Jackie Kennedy as she grieves her husband's death, while he is trying to get to Philadelphia.

programme.title: Dark Shadows
programme.desc: Entombed for 200 years after betraying a witch, 18th-century vampire Barnabas Collins returns to his mansion in 1972, only to find his estate in ruins and his family plagued by macabre secrets in this deliciously gothic remake of the classic TV series.

programme.title: Irresistible
programme.desc: Gary, a political strategist, thinks that the key to converting supporters for their Democratic National Committee is backing the mayoral bid of a retired US Marine in a predominantly right-wing town in Wisconsin. But when the Republican National Committee discovers this strategy, they send in their best political strategist, Faith, who happens to be Gary's long-time nemesis in the political arena.

programme.title: Little Children
programme.desc: Best Actress nominee Kate Winslet gives a tour-de-force performance in this gripping and incisive slice of suburban life set in Massachusetts. She plays an unhappy housewife who enters into a ruinous affair with a restless stay-at-home dad (Patrick Wilson). Best Supporting Actor nominee Jackie Earle Haley costars as a paroled pedophile trying to jump-start his life. Directed by Todd Field, who co-wrote the script with Tom Perrotta, upon whose novel the Oscar-nominated screenplay is based.

programme.title: Exterminate All the Brutes
programme.sub-title: Part 3: Killing at a Distance or...How I Thoroughly Enjoyed the Outing
programme.desc: A look back at human migration, trade and weaponry shows how Europeans used industrialized steel to conduct warfare from ever-greater distances. Also: an exploration of the endless cycle of militarization throughout the centuries—from George Washington's efforts to jump-start American arms manufacturing to the Monroe Doctrine and, finally, to the horrors of Hiroshima and Nagasaki.

programme.title: Exterminate All the Brutes
programme.sub-title: Part 4: The Bright Colors of Facism
