programme.desc: A look at the challenge of reconciling America's true history with its ideals of freedom and democracy points to the struggle for native representation and the legacy of slavery in institutionalized racism today. Reflecting on his time in Berlin, filmmaker Raoul Peck links the modern resurgence of white nationalism with fascism, slavery, colonialism and Nazism. Series finale.

programme.title: The Nevers
programme.desc: In 1899 London, Amalia True and Penance Adair work to protect their kind from widespread, deepening antipathy, three years after an inexplicable event suddenly equipped them with extraordinary abilities. Meanwhile, police inspector Frank Mundi investigates a string of murders at the hands of a reportedly Touched and highly dangerous serial killer named Maladie. Series premiere.

programme.title: Snow White and the Huntsman
programme.desc: In this rousing take on the classic tale, an evil queen orders the death of Snow White, who is being trained in the art of war by a huntsman. Meanwhile, a prince becomes enthralled by Snow White's beauty and strength.

programme.title: Frequency
programme.desc: In this well-acted fantasy about changing history, James Caviezel plays a grieving cop who hears the voice of his dead father (Dennis Quaid) while experimenting with a ham-radio set. Together, they try to stop the events that led to the man's death. Andre Braugher.

programme.title: Man on a Ledge
programme.desc: An NYPD hostage negotiator attempts to talk cop-turned-fugitive Nick Cassidy (Sam Worthington) down from a high ledge, but she learns that he may have a hidden motive for threatening to take his own life in this pulse-pounding thriller.

programme.title: The Sentinel
programme.desc: Sparks fly in this riveting thriller about a Secret Service agent investigating his mentor, who is suspected of plotting to assassinate the president while having an affair with the First Lady. Adapted from the novel by Gerald Petievich, who served in the U.S. Army Intelligence Corps and worked at the Treasury Department.

programme.title: The Photograph
programme.desc: The estranged daughter of a famed photographer initiates a romantic relationship with an up-and-coming journalist who is working on a story about her late mother's life and artistic legacy after discovering an old photograph in a safe-deposit box.

programme.title: Ted
programme.desc: In this quirky comedy, a child successfully wishes that his teddy bear could come to life, but he gets more than he bargained for when the stuffed animal follows him into adulthood and complicates his relationship with a beautiful woman.

programme.title: Just My Luck
programme.desc: Sizzling star Lindsay Lohan sparkles in this romantic comedy about a lucky career gal whose good fortunes are inexplicably reversed after she kisses the unluckiest guy in town at a masked ball. Chris Pine, Faizon Love, Missi Pyle. Directed by Donald Petrie.

programme.title: The Wedding Date
programme.desc: Debra Messing is absolutely engaging in this smart and witty romantic comedy as a neurotic, single New Yorker who hires a polished male escort (Dermot Mulroney) for her sister's nuptials in England after she learns that the best man is her ex-fiancé. Holland Taylor, Jeremy Sheffield, Amy Adams, Jack Davenport, Peter Egan, Sarah Parish, Jolyon James.

programme.title: Dirty Dancing: Havana Nights
programme.desc: Sizzling dance scenes spice up this pleasing follow-up to the 1987 blockbuster \"Dirty Dancing.\" In 1958 Cuba, an American teen (Romola Garai) has the time of her life when she meets a hot dancer (Diego Luna). As he teaches her the Cuban style, the two grow closer and decide to enter a contest. Patrick Swayze, star of the original film, has a cameo. Sela Ward.

programme.title: Down and Out in Beverly Hills
programme.desc: A bum winds up as the houseguest of a wealthy couple. A remake of a 1932 Jean Renoir comedy, 'Boudu Saved from Drowning.'.

programme.title: Wanderlust
programme.desc: In this hilarious comedy, an unemployed Manhattan businessman and his wife move into a seemingly idyllic, clothing-optional hippie commune called Elysium, which may cause more problems in their marriage than it solves.

programme.title: Dante's Peak
programme.desc: Pierce Brosnan stars as a volcanologist in this action-packed thriller featuring impressive special effects. Harry Dalton (Brosnan) warns a Washington town of an impending eruption, but its residents are reluctant to evacuate...until it's too late. Linda Hamilton.

programme.title: Ray
programme.desc: Add this Best Picture nominee about the life of singer Ray Charles (1930-2004) to the list of great screen bios. Best Actor Jamie Foxx is fantastic, bringing lots of heart and tons of soul to his portrayal of the music legend.

programme.title: The Blind Side
programme.desc: This inspirational drama stars Sandra Bullock as Leigh Anne Touhy, a headstrong, wealthy Memphis woman who welcomes into her home Michael Oher, a deeply troubled African-American high-school student who turns out to be gifted at playing football.

programme.title: Pray, Obey, Kill
programme.desc: Series premiere. A five-part documentary revisits a complex Swedish murder case from 2004 that gained global attention. On a cold night in January, gunshots rang out across the remote Swedish village Knutby, home to a small, tight-knit Pentecostal congregation, leaving a young woman murdered in her bed and her neighbor suffering from multiple bullet wounds.

programme.title: Emma (?)
programme.desc: A headstrong, high-spirited, and privileged young woman severely overestimates her matchmaking abilities as she meddles in the romantic lives of people in her small and sleepy English town during the 1800s. Hard-won knowledge about the intricacies of love compels her to reconsider her vow never to marry.

programme.title: Collateral Beauty
programme.desc: A New York adman deals with the pain of losing a child by writing letters to Time, Death and Love. He is soon visited by representations of the three concepts, who try to help him return to some semblance of a normal life in this uplifting drama.

programme.title: The Book of Henry
programme.desc: A young boy learns that his next-door neighbor is being abused by her stepfather, and starts writing a book about how to rescue her. When his mother discovers his plans, she decides to enact them herself in this moving drama.

programme.title: Ulee's Gold
programme.desc: Peter Fonda's subtle performance as a widowed Florida beekeeper guides Victor Nunez's simple tale. When Ulysses Jackson (Fonda) discovers that his son is in danger, he is forced to break free from his secure routine to save his family---and himself. Patricia Richardson, Christine Dunford.

programme.title: Lay the Favorite
programme.desc: In this winning comedy, a kindhearted Florida stripper becomes a Las Vegas cocktail waitress and forms a lucrative partnership with a professional sports gambler. But when the gambler's wife turns jealous, all bets are off.

programme.title: Coupe de Ville
programme.desc: Three rival brothers drive the classic car to Florida for their mother's 50th-birthday present. Patrick Dempsey, Arye Gross, Daniel Stern. Tammy: Annabeth Gish. Betty Libner: Rita Taggart. Fred Libner: Alan Arkin. Joe Roth directed.

programme.title: Dunkirk
programme.desc: In this pulse-pounding historical thriller set during the early days of WWII, a number of civilian boats set out to rescue 400,000 British and Allied troops trapped on the beaches of Dunkirk, France, before they are decimated by Nazi forces.

programme.title: The Namesake
programme.desc: A Bengali family tries to acclimate to life in the U.S. in this poignant and bittersweet saga of cultures clashing across generations. Their teenage son (Kal Penn) does not embrace their Indian heritage until he visits Calcutta, where he gains an understanding of the importance of his family's past. Indian-born Mira Nair directed from a script by Sooni Taraporevala, who adapted Pulitzer Prize-winner Jhumpa Lahiri's novel. Bollywood superstar Tabu costars as Penn's old-world mother.

programme.title: Lincoln
programme.desc: In this literate, inspiring historical drama, Abraham Lincoln attempts to outlaw slavery by fighting for the passage of the 13th Amendment to the Constitution, all while negotiating peace with the South and dealing with his mentally unstable wife.

programme.title: Pray, Obey, Kill
programme.desc: Series premiere. A five-part documentary revisits a complex Swedish murder case from 2004 that gained global attention. On a cold night in January, gunshots rang out across the remote Swedish village Knutby, home to a small, tight-knit Pentecostal congregation, leaving a young woman murdered in her bed and her neighbor suffering from multiple bullet wounds.

programme.title: Last Week Tonight With John Oliver
programme.sub-title: Last Week Tonight with John Oliver 217

programme.title: The Watch
programme.desc: Four suburbanites stumble upon an alien invasion while volunteering as a neighborhood-watch group, and they fight to protect their block from evil extraterrestrials in this madcap sci-fi comedy.

programme.title: Contraband
programme.desc: This nail-biting thriller follows smuggler Chris Farraday (Mark Wahlberg) as he faces ruthless drug lords, vicious criminals, corrupt officials and trigger-happy hit men in a bid to help his desperate brother-in-law settle a debt.

programme.title: Ford v Ferrari
programme.desc: In the 1960s, Ferrari is an untouchable figure in racing. With Enzo Ferrari ardently chasing after excellence, the company is irrefutably the best there is. Ford's Henry Ford II wants in on the success, and so he journeys to Italy to propose a merger with the automobile giant. His plan, however, is met with ridicule. With a hurt ego, he enlists the help of car designer Carroll Shelby and driver Ken Miles to build a car that would defeat Ferrari at the 1966 24 Hours of Le Mans.

programme.title: Gamer
programme.desc: Gerard Butler stars in this high-octane action spectacle as Kable, a flesh-and-blood man whose actions are controlled by popular champion gamer Simon (Logan Lerman) in a deadly first-person-shooter game called \"Slayers.\" Because the program is hugely popular, the game's unscrupulous creator (Michael C. Hall) has made a fortune from it and will do everything in his power to make sure Kable can never escape the game. Directed by Mark Neveldine and Brian Taylor.

programme.title: The Good Lie
programme.desc: Sudanese refugees get a second chance at life when a humanitarian effort brings them to America.

programme.title: Precious (?)
programme.desc: This inspirational drama centers on an illiterate, pregnant teen with little hope for the future, until the opportunity to attend an alternative school changes the course of her life.

programme.title: Brubaker
programme.desc: A new inmate at a run-down Southern prison witnesses several instances of gross misconduct and corruption, later revealing to the guards and administrators that he's not a criminal at all, but the new warden, assigned by the governor to infiltrate the facility undercover.

programme.title: Keeping Up with the Steins
programme.desc: A Hollywood agent plans an extravagant bar mitzvah in Dodger Stadium to top a celebration thrown by his bitter rival. Jeremy Piven (\"Entourage\") stars in this warm and funny family comedy. Jami Gertz, Daryl Hannah, Garry Marshall, Doris Roberts, Daryl Sabara. Directed by Scott Marshall.

programme.title: Boys and Girls
programme.desc: \"When Harry Met Sally...\" is given a lively Generation X twist in this vibrant romantic teen comedy. Despite disliking one another through the years, rigid Ryan (Freddie Prinze Jr.) and whimsical free spirit Jennifer (Claire Forlani) find love when their platonic relationship begins to spark into high romance while at college. Jason Biggs, Amanda Detmer, Heather Donahue, Alyson Hannigan.

programme.title: Darkest Hour
programme.desc: This riveting historical drama depicts the early days of Winston Churchill's leadership of the U.K. during WWII, as he tries to rally the nation to action while many of his contemporaries advocate peace talks with Hitler.

programme.title: Belly
programme.desc: A slick, enlightening drama about two urban drug dealers (Nas, DMX) who come to a crossroads in their lives and friendship. The absorbing story follows two small-time hoods who hope their New York City street smarts will help them hit it big in Omaha. While one pursues a life of crime, the other's life changes when he becomes a daddy. Taral Hicks, Tionne \"T-Boz\" Watkins, Method Man, Hassan Johnson.

programme.title: Gangs of New York
programme.desc: In this sprawling epic about America, a young man in 1860s New York City seeks to avenge his father's death decades earlier at the hands of a hardened gang leader during a large skirmish between warring clans. He befriends the brutal crime lord, gaining his trust in order to get close enough to exact revenge.

programme.title: Abraham Lincoln: Vampire Hunter
programme.desc: President Abraham Lincoln moonlights as a vampire hunter after learning that his mother was killed by bloodsuckers in this wildly fun supernatural action thriller adapted from the genre-bending novel.

programme.title: Much Ado About Nothing
programme.desc: In this modern retelling of Shakespeare's hilarious battle-of-the-sexes comedy, a bickering man and woman are tricked into falling in love as a wedding is jeopardized by malicious rumors about the bride-to-be.

programme.title: American Reunion
programme.desc: Jim (Jason Biggs), Michelle and the rest of the gang return to East Great Falls for their 10-year high-school reunion in this poignant comedy. Meanwhile, Finch still looks back with lust at that perfect night he spent with Stiffler's mom.

programme.title: They Came Together
programme.desc: This hysterical spoof of romantic-comedy clichés follows a couple, Molly and Joel, as they meet and fall in love amid the most-overused tropes of the genre, from the quirky best friend to the temporary breakup in the third act.

programme.title: Yesterday
programme.desc: A bus accident knocks out aspiring singer-songwriter Jack Malik. Upon waking up, he discovers that he's living in a world where The Beatles never existed. As a result, he's able to pass off their songs as his own.

programme.title: Stuber
programme.desc: After a clash with Teijo, a wanted criminal, results in the death of his partner Morris, LAPD detective Vic vows to track down the man and exact revenge. When he gets a lead as to where his man might be, Vic, visually-impaired because of a Lasik surgery, orders an Uber ride and meets the witty and mild-mannered Stu, his driver. Stu now has to go through the wild goose chase with Vic, all the while avoiding danger and a one-star rating.

programme.title: In the Heart of the Sea
programme.desc: In this harrowing historical drama set in the winter of 1820, the crew of the New England whaling ship the Essex struggle to survive after an attack by a rogue sperm whale leaves them stranded at sea for 90 days.

programme.title: The Talented Mr. Ripley
programme.desc: Matt Damon, Jude Law and Gwyneth Paltrow star in this chilling adaptation of Patricia Highsmith's novel about a social-climbing psychopath. Damon is superb as Tom Ripley, a charming mimic whose obsession with a wealthy playboy (Law) turns deadly. Cate Blanchett, Philip Seymour Hoffman. Directed by Anthony Minghella.

programme.title: Battle for the Planet of the Apes
programme.desc: In the fifth and last chapter of the original series, Caesar strives to foster peace between his simian peers and the surviving humans. He confronts opposition from a radical gorilla general, and must also face off against violent mutant humans.

programme.title: Deck the Halls
programme.desc: In this uproarious holiday farce, an uptight optometrist hits the roof when his neighbor decides to decorate his house with enough Christmas lights to be seen from space.

programme.title: Summer Rental
programme.desc: A harried suburbanite gets into a number of misadventures during a family vacation that culminates in a boat race.

programme.title: La La Land
programme.desc: In this wondrous musical, struggling actress Mia and aspiring jazz pianist Sebastian begin a whirlwind romance as they both pursue their dreams in L.A. However, their relationship is challenged when their careers pull them in different directions.

programme.title: This Means War
programme.desc: Big laughs abound when two top CIA spies find their enduring friendship put to the ultimate test when they engage in an all-out battle to win the affections of a beautiful woman after they discover they are both dating her.

programme.title: Get Over It
programme.desc: Kirsten Dunst stars in this charming teen romance about a guy (Ben Foster) who tries to win back his girlfriend by getting a part in the school play. With the help of a friend (Dunst), he hones his acting skills and discovers the meaning of true love. Sisqo, Martin Short, Melissa Sagemiller, Shane West, Colin Hanks, Mila Kunis.

programme.title: Lola Versus
programme.desc: This touching comedy focuses on a 29-year-old woman named Lola, who gets dumped by her longtime boyfriend and finds herself approaching 30 as a single woman, launching her into a hilarious existential crisis as she dives back into the dating scene with the help of her two best friends, the outspoken Alice and the sweet-natured Henry.

programme.title: The Warrior's Way
programme.desc: A legendary Asian swordsman (Jang Dong-gun) must fight for his life after giving up his warrior ways and hiding out in the American badlands in this thrilling Western-martial-arts hybrid.

programme.title: The Recruit
programme.desc: Al Pacino and Colin Farrell star in this taut thriller from Roger Donaldson, the director of \"No Way Out\" and \"Thirteen Days.\" Pacino plays a CIA operative who recruits a computer whiz to find a mole in the agency's ranks. While studying at the agency's secret training camp, the recruit falls for a fellow student and learns that nothing is what it seems.

programme.title: The Debt
programme.desc: In this taut thriller, celebrated Mossad agent Rachel Singer must find out the truth when a man appears claiming to be the Nazi war criminal she supposedly killed 30 years earlier, during a mission that made her a legend.

programme.title: Munich
programme.desc: A secret Israeli squad is assigned to track down and execute the Palestinian terrorists suspected of murdering 11 Israeli athletes at the 1972 Munich Olympics. Steven Spielberg directed this riveting suspense thriller starring Eric Bana (\"Troy\"). Daniel Craig, Ciaran Hinds, Mathieu Kassovitz.

programme.title: Hostage
programme.desc: A small-town cop, tortured by a past failure as a hostage negotiator, is caught in the middle of two kidnappings in this stylish thriller.

programme.title: Ready or Not
programme.desc: Four college buddies find themselves on the adventure of their lives, when on the morning after a Las Vegas bachelor party, they end up stranded deep in Mexico penniless, being chased, falling in love, and fighting to make it back across the border in time for the wedding.

programme.title: View From the Top
programme.desc: Gwyneth Paltrow's high-flying turn propels this first-class comedy about flight attendants. Paltrow plays Donna Jensen, who leaves the trailer park to become a stewardess. With help from her mentor (Candice Bergen) and an oddball instructor (Mike Myers), she sets her sights on joining the prestigious Royalty Airlines. Christina Applegate, Kelly Preston.

programme.title: Jane Eyre
programme.desc: A young woman (Mia Wasikowska) must come to terms with her own turbulent past after fleeing from the estate where she worked as a governess for a wealthy man in this exquisite romantic drama based on the classic novel by Charlotte Brontë. Directed by Cary Fukunaga.

programme.title: Rounders
programme.desc: Matt Damon plays a law student whose poker skills create a dilemma of choice between pursuing the law and the excitement of testing himself against the best in the world of underground high-stakes games. The scales are tipped toward the latter when the young man must aid a jailbird pal (Edward Norton) in debt to mobsters. Gretchen Mol, John Turturro, Famke Janssen, John Malkovich, Martin Landau.

programme.title: Human Capital
programme.desc: After meeting Quint, the father of his daughter's boyfriend, Drew, a local real estate agent, decides to invest in his latest hedge fund, though through illegal means. It signals the start of many troubles for him, which is only amplified by the revelation that his wife, Ronnie, is expecting twins. When an unintentional manslaughter takes place, the complicated relations between the two families become even more tangled.

programme.title: The Fighter
programme.desc: This drama depicts the incredible true story of boxer Micky Ward (Mark Wahlberg) and his struggle to emerge from under the shadow of his half-brother Dicky Eklund (Christian Bale), a former champion pugilist who lost his career to crack addiction.

programme.title: The Curious Case of Benjamin Button
programme.desc: In this remarkable tale, a man is born in New Orleans just after World War I, but he is already in his eighties and then proceeds to live his life aging in reverse into the 21st century, experiencing joy and sadness, loves lost and found, and the meaning of timelessness.

programme.title: Lucy in the Sky
programme.desc: After a life-altering expedition into deep space, Lucy Cola, an astronaut, must return to Earth and reintegrate into everyday life. However, Lucy's cosmic experiences begin to take a toll on her connection to the real world as she spirals into a mental state that her world is too small to contain.

programme.title: Moonlight Mile
programme.desc: Dustin Hoffman and Susan Sarandon star in writer-director Brad Silberling's heartfelt drama about a New England couple mourning their slain daughter while trying to accept her equally distraught fiancé (Jake Gyllenhaal) as the son they never had. Holly Hunter, Dabney Coleman.

programme.title: Motherless Brooklyn
programme.desc: A private detective living with Tourette's syndrome in 1950s New York City tries to solve the murder of his best friend and mentor. His case takes him through the Harlem jazz scene, the Brooklyn slums, and into the ranks of the city's most powerful men.

programme.title: City on a Hill
programme.sub-title: Is the Total Black, Being Spoken
programme.desc: Jackie uncovers one of Decourcy's informants and hatches a plan to use him as a pawn to discredit the assistant district attorney. Decourcy stops by the Rohr house, hoping to get something out of Jenny that he can use against her husband. Siobhan receives some welcome news, in the midst of plotting her run for City Council. And her client, Kelvin Campbell, is released from custody, though he can't free himself of what happened on Valentine's Day.

programme.title: DESUS & MERO
programme.desc: Actor-singer Andra Day (\"The United States vs. Billie Holiday\") is the guest.

programme.title: City on a Hill
programme.sub-title: Is the Total Black, Being Spoken
programme.desc: Jackie uncovers one of Decourcy's informants and hatches a plan to use him as a pawn to discredit the assistant district attorney. Decourcy stops by the Rohr house, hoping to get something out of Jenny that he can use against her husband. Siobhan receives some welcome news, in the midst of plotting her run for City Council. And her client, Kelvin Campbell, is released from custody, though he can't free himself of what happened on Valentine's Day.

programme.title: Shameless
programme.desc: Ian and Mickey shop for furniture for their new place and Kev and V look for a buyer for the Alibi. While Lip settles for a new job, Carl finally finds his calling in a new role on the police force. Debbie plunges into a treacherous world when she meets someone new. Frank comes to terms with his own mortality. Series finale.

programme.title: DESUS & MERO
programme.desc: Actor-singer Andra Day (\"The United States vs. Billie Holiday\") is the guest.

programme.sub-title: Is the Total Black, Being Spoken

While Lip settles for a new job, Carl finally finds his calling in a new role on the police force. Debbie plunges into a treacherous world when she meets someone new. Frank comes to terms with his own mortality. Series finale.

programme.title: Red
programme.desc: Retired CIA hit man Frank Moses (Bruce Willis) and his former colleagues race to find out why they've been targeted for death by their former organization and uncover a conspiracy implicating some prominent politicians in this rousing action comedy.

programme.title: Celeste Barber: Challenge Accepted (?)
programme.desc: Celeste Barber explains the story behind some of her most famous parodies.

programme.title: Silver Linings Playbook
programme.desc: In this charming crowd-pleaser, a bipolar man named Pat attempts to get his life together after spending eight months in an asylum following assault charges. He soon bonds with a promiscuous widow, and offers to be her partner for a dance competition if she'll help him contact his ex-wife.

programme.title: Gridiron Gang
programme.desc: In this inspirational sports drama based on a true story, a probation officer gives teenage delinquents a chance at redemption by starting a football team at a juvenile-detention camp.

programme.title: Alex Cross
programme.desc: In this masterfully tense thriller, homicide detective Alex Cross pursues a sadistic serial killer obsessed with making his victims suffer, but the case gets personal when the killer targets Cross' loved ones.

programme.title: Snatch
programme.desc: Guy Ritchie (\"Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels\") wrote and directed this darkly comic crime thriller about an unbelievably large diamond and the big and small-time thieves who try to get their hands on it, with varying degrees of incompetence. Benicio Del Toro, Dennis Farina, Brad Pitt, Jason Statham, Vinnie Jones, Alan Ford, Rade Sherbedgia.

programme.title: Carlito's Way
programme.desc: An ex-convict tries to go straight, but while running a nightclub his drug-addicted lawyer and an ambitious young criminal make it difficult for him to get out of the life. Meanwhile, he tries to win back the woman he loves who doesn't trust that he's trying to stay on the right side of the law.

programme.title: 21 Bridges
programme.desc: A demoted NYPD detective secures an opportunity to redeem himself by taking the lead on a manhunt that encompasses the entire city. However, as he begins to uncover new clues, he learns of a plot that implicates his colleagues are in a crime ring. He will find that the tables have turned as he goes from predator to prey.

programme.title: Shameless
programme.desc: Ian and Mickey shop for furniture for their new place and Kev and V look for a buyer for the Alibi. While Lip settles for a new job, Carl finally finds his calling in a new role on the police force. Debbie plunges into a treacherous world when she meets someone new. Frank comes to terms with his own mortality. Series finale.

programme.title: DESUS & MERO
programme.desc: Actor-singer Andra Day (\"The United States vs. Billie Holiday\") is the guest.

programme.title: Shameless
programme.desc: Ian and Mickey shop for furniture for their new place and Kev and V look for a buyer for the Alibi. While Lip settles for a new job, Carl finally finds his calling in a new role on the police force. Debbie plunges into a treacherous world when she meets someone new. Frank comes to terms with his own mortality. Series finale.

programme.title: Law Abiding Citizen
programme.desc: When the family of Clyde Shelton are killed during a home invasion and hotshot prosecutor Nick Rice fails to deliver justice, Shelton wages a deadly vigilante campaign in this nail-biting thriller.

programme.title: Snatch
programme.desc: Guy Ritchie (\"Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels\") wrote and directed this darkly comic crime thriller about an unbelievably large diamond and the big and small-time thieves who try to get their hands on it, with varying degrees of incompetence. Benicio Del Toro, Dennis Farina, Brad Pitt, Jason Statham, Vinnie Jones, Alan Ford, Rade Sherbedgia.

During the First World War, two young British officers receive orders to venture deep behind enemy lines to deliver a critical message that could prevent the massacre of a British battalion in a trap laid by the enemy. At the bidding of their superior officers, the young privates put their own lives on the line, as it could mean the difference between life and death for 1,600 of their brothers in arms.

programme.title: Meet Joe Black
programme.desc: The Grim Reaper comes to Earth to retrieve a media tycoon shortly before his 65th birthday, but agrees to grant him a little more time if the mogul will teach him about life's pleasures. The doomed man jumps at the chance, but doesn't foresee that Death will fall in love with his beautiful daughter.

programme.title: The Assassination of Jesse James by the Coward Robert Ford
programme.desc: Writer-director Andrew Dominik's thoughtful, elegiac saga is a dead-on throwback to classic Westerns of yore. Brad Pitt gives a bang-up performance as the notorious outlaw living out his final days in 1882 before being gunned down by a member of his gang (Casey Affleck). Features a cameo by political pundit James Carville as Governor Crittenden and rocker Nick Cave as a saloon singer. Cave also co-wrote the score. Actor-playwright Sam Shepard costars as Jesse's brother Frank.

programme.title: The Gunman
programme.desc: Jim Terrier is an ex-mercenary whose last assassination sparked a civil war. Now working as a humanitarian in Africa to atone for his sins, it is not long before Jim's past catches up with him.

programme.title: Mob Town
programme.desc: In 1957, an FBI agent teams up with a local police officer to monitor the activities of New York City's most notorious Mafia leaders as they prepare for a large-scale gathering in upstate New York. It is up to the unlikely duo to piece together the purpose of such a meeting and thwart any instances of violence that may erupt as a result.

programme.title: Sahara
programme.desc: Clive Cussler's thrilling bestseller comes to life in this action-packed adventure. Matthew McConaughey stars as an intrepid explorer who helps a doctor (Penelope Cruz) contain a plague in Africa while searching for buried treasure. Breck Eisner directed. Steve Zahn, Lambert Wilson, Glynn Turman, Delroy Lindo, William H. Macy.

programme.title: Dallas Buyers Club
programme.desc: The powerful true story of Texas electrician Ron Woodroof, who was diagnosed as HIV positive in 1986, and subsequently devoted his life to providing unapproved drugs and supplements to fellow HIV patients during an era when doctors were still struggling to understand the virus.

programme.title: City on a Hill
programme.sub-title: Is the Total Black, Being Spoken
programme.desc: Jackie uncovers one of Decourcy's informants and hatches a plan to use him as a pawn to discredit the assistant district attorney. Decourcy stops by the Rohr house, hoping to get something out of Jenny that he can use against her husband. Siobhan receives some welcome news, in the midst of plotting her run for City Council. And her client, Kelvin Campbell, is released from custody, though he can't free himself of what happened on Valentine's Day.

programme.title: Shameless
programme.desc: Ian and Mickey shop for furniture for their new place and Kev and V look for a buyer for the Alibi. While Lip settles for a new job, Carl finally finds his calling in a new role on the police force. Debbie plunges into a treacherous world when she meets someone new. Frank comes to terms with his own mortality. Series finale.

programme.title: Lawless
programme.desc: In this stunning crime drama set during the Great Depression, three rebellious brothers get into the bootlegging business and battle treachery on both sides of the law as they expand their operation into the big city.

programme.title: Becky
programme.desc: After her mother's death, 13-year-old Becky goes on a weekend getaway with her father, Jeff, to bond and reconnect with him. Jeff, however, has a different plan—he brings along his new girlfriend Kayla in an attempt to bring her closer to Becky. However, when four newly-escaped prisoners show up and break into the lake house they are staying at, their plans change, and the fun trip becomes a nightmare. Becky now has to do everything she can to keep the three of them safe.

programme.title: Dallas Buyers Club
programme.desc: The powerful true story of Texas electrician Ron Woodroof, who was diagnosed as HIV positive in 1986, and subsequently devoted his life to providing unapproved drugs and supplements to fellow HIV patients during an era when doctors were still struggling to understand the virus.

programme.title: Hoosiers
programme.desc: A disgraced basketball coach takes a job at a small Indiana high-school and leads the small squad on an improbable run for a state championship. Meanwhile, he helps the town drunk, a former basketball player, redeem himself.

programme.title: Lethal Weapon
programme.desc: First entry in the action-thriller series that teamed Mel Gibson and Danny Glover as a seemingly psychotic cop and his common-sense family-man partner, respectively. In this outing, they investigate a woman's plunge from a high-rise and its connection to a drug cartel.

programme.title: Cop Land
programme.desc: An honest, small-town New Jersey sheriff (Sylvester Stallone) is torn between loyalty to his fellow officers and his responsibility to uphold the law after a member of Internal Affairs asks him to help bring down a group of corrupt cops. Robert De Niro, Harvey Keitel, Ray Liotta, Peter Berg, Janeane Garofalo, Robert Patrick, Michael Rapaport, Annabella Sciorra, Noah Emmerich, Cathy Moriarty.

programme.title: Kate & Leopold
programme.desc: Meg Ryan and Hugh Jackman are charming in this time-tripping romantic comedy. Jackman plays the Duke of Albany, who is whisked through a portal in time from 1876 to modern-day Manhattan, where a romance begins when he woos a jaded executive (Ryan). Directed by James Mangold (\"Girl, Interrupted\"). Liev Schreiber, Breckin Meyer, Natasha Lyonne.

programme.title: Made in Italy
programme.desc: Robert, a London-based bohemian artist, has been estranged from his adult son. They travel to Tuscany, Italy, to take care of business left to him by his late wife. He inherits a once beautiful villa, only to see it in a sorry state of disrepair. What turns out to be an initially quick trip becomes an extended stay as father and son try to repair the house, and in the process find their own way of trying to repair their strained relationship.

programme.title: Wet Hot American Summer
programme.desc: It's 1981 and the last day at a Maine summer camp, where both the counselors and the campers are looking for a good time.This hilarious spoof of the summer-camp films of the '70s and '80s features Janeane Garofalo as the chief counselor and David Hyde Pierce as the object of her affection. Written by Michael Showalter and David Wain of the sketch comedy The State. Paul Rudd, Molly Shannon, Amy Poehler, Christopher Meloni.

programme.title: Red
programme.desc: Retired CIA hit man Frank Moses (Bruce Willis) and his former colleagues race to find out why they've been targeted for death by their former organization and uncover a conspiracy implicating some prominent politicians in this rousing action comedy.

programme.title: Lethal Weapon
programme.desc: First entry in the action-thriller series that teamed Mel Gibson and Danny Glover as a seemingly psychotic cop and his common-sense family-man partner, respectively. In this outing, they investigate a woman's plunge from a high-rise and its connection to a drug cartel.

programme.title: Lethal Weapon 2
programme.desc: Two L.A. detectives—one a loose cannon, the other a cautious family man—face off with a vicious South African drug cartel that is operating under the cover of diplomatic immunity.

programme.title: Smokin' Aces 2: Assassins' Ball (?)
programme.desc: The world's top assassins go gunning for an FBI desk jockey in this prequel. When word gets out that G-man Walter Weed (Tom Berenger) has a price of $3 million on his head, every killer in the world begins loading up on ammo in hopes of making the hit. But Agent Baker (Clayne Crawford) and his team are determined to keep Weed alive, even if it means taking up arms against the psychotic Tremor family, whose notorious reputation for carnage precedes them.

programme.title: DESUS & MERO
programme.desc: Actor-singer Andra Day (\"The United States vs. Billie Holiday\") is the guest.

programme.title: Lawless
programme.desc: In this stunning crime drama set during the Great Depression, three rebellious brothers get into the bootlegging business and battle treachery on both sides of the law as they expand their operation into the big city.

programme.title: Rob Roy
programme.desc: Epic tale of the18th-century Scottish outlaw Robert Roy MacGregor, whose battles to protect his family from corrupt moneylenders made him a hero.

programme.title: Wyatt Earp
programme.desc: Character study of the legendary lawman details the future marshal's childhood and his father's attempts to instill a love of family and the law in his son. As an adult, a tragedy triggers a drunken downward spiral that leads to exploits as a gunslinger. Ultimately, Earp finds redemption as a lawman.

programme.title: Congo
programme.desc: An ex-CIA operative leads a quest into the dangerous African Congo in search of her presumed dead fiancé. Along for the ride is a primatologist, his assistant, a talking gorilla, a Romanian backer with his own agenda and a jungle-savvy mercenary. Based on the novel by Michael Crichton.

programme.title: Stargate
programme.desc: An expert translates hieroglyphs on an ancient ring, which turn out to be a map to a portal to another world. The Army sends two men to pass through the stargate and report back what is on the other side.

programme.title: Hereditary
programme.desc: When her mentally ill mother passes away, a woman named Annie and her husband, son and daughter all mourn her loss. The family turn to different means to handle their grief, including Annie and her daughter both flirting with the supernatural. They all begin to have disturbing, otherworldly experiences linked to the sinister secrets and emotional trauma that have been passed through the generations of their family.

programme.title: The Turning
programme.desc: A young woman relocates to a Gothic estate in the Maine countryside to serve as a governess to two young and psychologically disturbed orphans. She soon learns that there is something strange and sinister about the mansion and the children under her care.

programme.title: At Close Range
programme.desc: Fact-based story of a bored, brooding teen lured into a life of crime by his smooth-talking, long-lost father who's come back into his life in 1978 rural Pennsylvania.

programme.title: The Godfather
programme.desc: Best Picture chronicles the epic tale of a 1940's mobster family in New York City, where the father builds an organized-crime empire and his three sons, to varying degrees, follow in his footsteps. Marlon Brando won Best Actor as the head of the \"family.\".

programme.title: The Loudest Voice
programme.desc: Emboldened by 9/11, Fox News CEO Roger Ailes uses the network to push a government agenda.

programme.title: City on a Hill
programme.sub-title: Is the Total Black, Being Spoken
programme.desc: Jackie uncovers one of Decourcy's informants and hatches a plan to use him as a pawn to discredit the assistant district attorney. Decourcy stops by the Rohr house, hoping to get something out of Jenny that he can use against her husband. Siobhan receives some welcome news, in the midst of plotting her run for City Council. And her client, Kelvin Campbell, is released from custody, though he can't free himself of what happened on Valentine's Day.

programme.title: DESUS & MERO
programme.desc: Actor-singer Andra Day (\"The United States vs. Billie Holiday\") is the guest.

programme.title: The To Do List
programme.desc: In this hilarious and raunchy comedy, a high-school valedictorian makes a list of sexual acts she wants to experience before college, and attempts to seek out the right guys for each task.

programme.title: Halloween H20: 20 Years Later (?)
programme.desc: Jamie Lee Curtis returns in this chilling 20th-anniversary sequel as madman Michael Myers' long-lost sister. Laurie Strode (Curtis) runs a prep school and lives a peaceful life---until her maniac brother returns to crash her son's Halloween party. But Laurie vows not to allow their bloody family history to repeat itself.

programme.title: The Witch
programme.desc: In this visceral horror thriller, a Puritan family in 1630s New England are exiled from their village, and are haunted by unseen forces that live in the wilderness bordering their new home. Later, they fall victim to fear and paranoia as they accuse their teenage daughter of witchcraft.

programme.title: Scary Stories to Tell in the Dark
programme.desc: Set in small town 1960s America, a terrifying mansion on the outskirts of town is home to a book of scary stories written by a young girl who was imprisoned there. Teens stumble across her book and must face their fears in order to survive.

programme.title: Throw Momma from the Train
programme.desc: An inept student offers to kill the ex-wife of his professor in exchange for the teacher murdering the student's mother.

programme.title: Mystic Pizza
programme.desc: Three young women come of age amid romantic entanglements while working at a Connecticut pizzeria shortly after graduating from high school.

programme.title: Legally Blonde 2: Red, White & Blonde
programme.desc: Reese Witherspoon shines as perpetually perky lawyer Elle Woods in this delightful sequel. When Elle discovers that her dog's mother is a victim of laboratory testing, she tries to persuade a congresswoman to back an animal-rights bill.

programme.title: Obvious Child
programme.desc: In this utterly unique comedy, a twentysomething female comic attempts to embrace adulthood after getting dumped, fired and pregnant. In time, her newfound vulnerability helps her to nurture a renewed sense of self-confidence.

programme.title: Saturday Night Fever
programme.desc: A working-class young man from Brooklyn is famous on the local disco scene, and has a complicated relationship with a fellow dancer who dreams of making it big in Manhattan.

programme.title: RoboCop
programme.desc: Futuristic thriller about a Detroit police officer who dies in the line of duty but is resurrected as a half-human automaton and programmed to serve justice at any cost—a quest that is often at odds with a thirst for revenge on the thugs who killed him.

programme.title: RoboCop 2
programme.desc: The mechanical policeman battles a corrupt corporation that profits from crime in Detroit and the company's psychotic cyborg whose main mission is to kill RoboCop.

programme.title: The Godfather, Part II
programme.desc: This sequel follows Vito Corleone's rise to the top of his Mafia family and his son Michael's fall from grace after taking over for his father. Best Picture winner.

programme.title: Taxi Driver
programme.desc: A mentally unstable Vietnam veteran makes his living as a cabbie in New York, attempts to date a campaign worker, and befriends an underage hooker who he tries to get out of the life.

programme.title: Passion In Prison (?)
programme.desc: Two incarcerated strippers use their talents to try to get out of prison.

programme.title: The Rental
programme.desc: Two young couples rent a scenic oceanside mansion for a celebratory weekend trip. The mood becomes increasingly unnerving as they begin to suspect that their Airbnb host is spying on them – and as the secrets that they have kept from each other begin to be revealed.

programme.title: Halloween: The Curse of Michael Myers
programme.desc: Murderer Michael Myers returns to his hometown of Haddonfield to kill his niece's child. A young man obsessed with Myers teams with the killer's former psychiatrist to stop him once and for all.

programme.title: The Final Girls
programme.desc: In this inventive horror comedy, a teen is pulled into the world of an 1980s slasher film that her recently deceased mother, a famous scream queen, once starred in. There, she must defeat a maniacal killer who's terrorizing everyone in sight.

programme.title: Long Hot Summers: The Story of The Style Council
programme.desc: Members of The Style Council reflect on their time as 80s pop icons, reliving their rise to fame, trend-defying music and fashion and their breakup amidst the backdrop of the Cold War. Featuring interviews with Paul Weller, Boy George and Martin Freeman.

programme.title: Teen Wolf
programme.desc: A misfit, picked-on teen's life turns around when he discovers he's descendant from a line of werewolves. By unleashing his inner beast, he becomes a basketball star, and works up the courage to try and win his dream girl away from her unpleasant boyfriend.

programme.title: Teen Wolf Too
programme.desc: A boxing scholarship brings out the beast in a teen, who inherits the family curse.

programme.title: Run This Town
programme.desc: Naive, young Toronto newspaper reporter Bram finds himself doing desk work instead of breaking hard-hitting stories, until he accidentally finds scandalous information about the city's controversial mayor, Rob Ford. Bram attempts to pry information from Ford's staff, who are trying to cover Ford's tracks and spin the story.

programme.title: Limitless
programme.desc: Struggling author Eddie Morra (Bradley Cooper) overcomes his writer's block with a new drug that unlocks the full potential of his brain, and he forges a partnership with a powerful businessman (Robert De Niro) in this inventive, exciting thriller. Meanwhile, some dangerous characters discover Eddie's secret and come gunning for his dwindling supply of the pharmaceutical.

programme.title: The Big Hit
programme.desc: Four expert hit men blast their way into a slave trader's stronghold, gaining the favor of a powerful mob boss. But when they kidnap a young heiress who happens to be the boss's goddaughter, they soon become targets themselves. A hard-hitting action-thriller executive produced by John Woo. Mark Wahlberg, Lou Diamond Phillips, Christina Applegate, Antonio Sabato Jr., Lela Rochon.

programme.title: Locke
programme.desc: In this tense and ingenious drama that takes place over the course of a night drive, a construction manager receives a crucial phone call that shakes his world and sparks a tragic chain of events that threaten to destroy his entire life.

programme.title: 21 Bridges
programme.desc: A demoted NYPD detective secures an opportunity to redeem himself by taking the lead on a manhunt that encompasses the entire city. However, as he begins to uncover new clues, he learns of a plot that implicates his colleagues are in a crime ring. He will find that the tables have turned as he goes from predator to prey.

programme.title: Shithouse
programme.desc: A homesick and lonely college freshman encounters a dynamic but emotionally guarded sophomore RA at a frat party. Their intimate heart-to-heart exchange leads to a poignant and mutually transformative experience on an emotional and intellectual level.

programme.title: Silver Linings Playbook
programme.desc: In this charming crowd-pleaser, a bipolar man named Pat attempts to get his life together after spending eight months in an asylum following assault charges. He soon bonds with a promiscuous widow, and offers to be her partner for a dance competition if she'll help him contact his ex-wife.

programme.title: Men in Kilts: A Roadtrip with Sam and Graham
The Gloaming
programme.desc: When Freddie puts Lily's life in jeopardy, Molly must race to save her.

programme.title: Men in Kilts: A Roadtrip with Sam and Graham
The Siege
programme.desc: Denzel Washington is excellent in this charged thriller as a federal agent investigating a terrorist group that's responsible for a number of bombings in New York City, which is placed under martial law when the culprits evade capture, with an autocratic general (Bruce Willis) in command. Annette Bening, Tony Shalhoub.

programme.title: Fantasy Island
programme.desc: A mysterious man invites several guests to his luxurious tropical island getaway, where he promises to make their fantasies come true. But they find themselves fighting for their lives and sanity when their wildest dreams become a nightmarish reality.

programme.title: Kingdom of Heaven
programme.desc: A French blacksmith joins the Crusades and tries to achieve peace between Muslims and Christians in this spectacular historical epic.

programme.title: Into the Blue
programme.desc: A sexy thriller about divers who find themselves battling sharks and ruthless criminals after discovering hidden treasure and a crashed plane loaded with cocaine.

programme.title: Into the Woods
programme.desc: In this spectacular adaptation of the Stephen Sondheim musical, a witch curses a baker and his wife, binding their fates to such fairy-tale characters as Cinderella, Little Red Riding Hood, Rapunzel and Jack of \"Jack and the Beanstalk.\".

programme.title: Fantasy Island
programme.desc: A mysterious man invites several guests to his luxurious tropical island getaway, where he promises to make their fantasies come true. But they find themselves fighting for their lives and sanity when their wildest dreams become a nightmarish reality.

programme.title: Papillon
programme.desc: A convicted French safecracker allies with a currency counterfeiter to escape from a penal colony on Devil's Island in French Guiana. They endure a life of trying hardship and seemingly endless misery as they wait for the perfect opportunity to escape.

programme.title: Men in Kilts: A Roadtrip with Sam and Graham
The Gloaming
programme.desc: When Freddie puts Lily's life in jeopardy, Molly must race to save her.

programme.title: What Lies Beneath
programme.desc: Harrison Ford and Michelle Pfeiffer star in this suspenseful thriller as Dr. Norman Spencer and his wife, Claire, who seem to have the perfect life. But his extramarital fling comes back to haunt them when Claire starts having disturbing visions of a young woman. Diana Scarwid. Robert Zemeckis directed.

programme.title: Into the Blue
programme.desc: A sexy thriller about divers who find themselves battling sharks and ruthless criminals after discovering hidden treasure and a crashed plane loaded with cocaine.

programme.title: Men in Kilts: A Roadtrip with Sam and Graham
The Siege
programme.desc: Denzel Washington is excellent in this charged thriller as a federal agent investigating a terrorist group that's responsible for a number of bombings in New York City, which is placed under martial law when the culprits evade capture, with an autocratic general (Bruce Willis) in command. Annette Bening, Tony Shalhoub.

programme.title: The Gloaming
programme.desc: When Freddie puts Lily's life in jeopardy, Molly must race to save her.

programme.title: A Beautiful Day in the Neighborhood
programme.desc: Lloyd Vogel is tasked with creating a profile of Fred Rogers, the creator and star of the successful children's program Mister Rogers' Neighborhood. He dutifully goes to the studio where his subject is filming his show, and soon enough, he is sitting down with him, asking him probing questions. However, Fred seems to have a different plan in mind. The interviewee suddenly becomes the interviewer, and he starts to help the writer sent for him in unexpected ways.

programme.title: Papillon
programme.desc: A convicted French safecracker allies with a currency counterfeiter to escape from a penal colony on Devil's Island in French Guiana. They endure a life of trying hardship and seemingly endless misery as they wait for the perfect opportunity to escape.

programme.title: Megan Leavey
programme.desc: In this moving drama, marine corporal Megan Leavey bonds with a military dog named Rex as the pair detect explosives in Iraq. When Leavey is injured and forced to return home, she vows to cut through the military's red tape to adopt Rex. Based on a true story.

programme.title: What Lies Beneath
programme.desc: Harrison Ford and Michelle Pfeiffer star in this suspenseful thriller as Dr. Norman Spencer and his wife, Claire, who seem to have the perfect life. But his extramarital fling comes back to haunt them when Claire starts having disturbing visions of a young woman. Diana Scarwid. Robert Zemeckis directed.

programme.title: The Devil's Own
programme.desc: Harrison Ford and Brad Pitt provide the star-power in this fast-paced thriller. An Irish terrorist (Pitt) escapes to New York, living under an assumed name with the family of noble cop Tom O'Meara (Ford). Tom eventually learns the truth about his boarder, but only after a strong bond forms between the two men. Nevertheless, Tom is duty-bound to bring the lad to justice.

programme.title: Robin Hood
programme.desc: Virtuous outlaw Robin Hood (Russell Crowe) and his band of spirited allies fight corruption in 13th-century England and battle a tyrannical sheriff who has assumed control of Nottingham in director Ridley Scott's dazzling tale of adventure. As Robin and his men rise to the status of folk heroes, the noble warrior finds himself falling for the lovely Lady Marion.

programme.title: The Gloaming
programme.desc: When Freddie puts Lily's life in jeopardy, Molly must race to save her.

programme.title: Sparkle
programme.desc: Three singing sisters take Motown by storm, and they experience the highs and lows of fame along the way in this inspirational musical drama.

programme.title: Down to Earth
programme.desc: Chris Rock rolls into reincarnation madness in this comedy based on 1978's \"Heaven Can Wait.\" When a heavenly mix-up causes struggling black stand-up comic Lance Barton (Rock) to die before his time, he is sent back down to the mortal world in the form of a rich---and white---old-timer named Charles Wellington. Regina King, Chazz Palminteri, Eugene Levy, Frankie Faison.

programme.title: Megan Leavey
programme.desc: In this moving drama, marine corporal Megan Leavey bonds with a military dog named Rex as the pair detect explosives in Iraq. When Leavey is injured and forced to return home, she vows to cut through the military's red tape to adopt Rex. Based on a true story.

programme.title: A Beautiful Day in the Neighborhood
programme.desc: Lloyd Vogel is tasked with creating a profile of Fred Rogers, the creator and star of the successful children's program Mister Rogers' Neighborhood. He dutifully goes to the studio where his subject is filming his show, and soon enough, he is sitting down with him, asking him probing questions. However, Fred seems to have a different plan in mind. The interviewee suddenly becomes the interviewer, and he starts to help the writer sent for him in unexpected ways.

programme.title: The Broken Hearts Gallery
programme.desc: After suffering a difficult breakup, Lucy experiences a chance encounter with Nick, an aspiring hotel manager. The pair then teams up to open an unusual art gallery that allows people to leave behind the mementos of former relationships and achieve closure.

programme.title: Down to Earth
programme.desc: Chris Rock rolls into reincarnation madness in this comedy based on 1978's \"Heaven Can Wait.\" When a heavenly mix-up causes struggling black stand-up comic Lance Barton (Rock) to die before his time, he is sent back down to the mortal world in the form of a rich---and white---old-timer named Charles Wellington. Regina King, Chazz Palminteri, Eugene Levy, Frankie Faison.

programme.title: Hot Tub Time Machine
programme.desc: This hilarious, raunchy comedy follows Adam and his three loser friends as they awaken after a night of drinking and hot-tubbing to find themselves back in 1986, where they try to fix all of the mistakes they made when they were younger. The foursome take advantage of this rip in the space-time continuum to win back lost loves and change their futures for the better.

programme.title: The Professional
programme.desc: After a 12-year-old girl's family is murdered, she hides out in the apartment of her hitman-neighbor; and offers to do chores if he will teach her to be an assassin.

programme.title: Brightburn
programme.desc: After an alien boy arrives on Earth and is adopted by a local couple, he lives in a rural farming area with them, showing amazing abilities and talents early on in life. But once he is bullied at school, the boy is sent on an evil path of retribution in this horror film based on the premise of Superman gone wrong.

programme.title: Misbehaviour (?)
programme.desc: Based on true events, this film shows how English feminist activists from the Women's Liberation Movement, led by Sally Alexander, disrupt the popular Miss World beauty pageant being held in London in 1970, when Miss Grenada candidate Jennifer Hosten becomes the first Black woman to win the title. American legend Bob Hope hosts the event, and becomes the subject of protest by the group because of his sexist-tinged comedy act.

programme.title: The Animal
programme.desc: Rob Schneider is hilarious in this comedy about Marvin Mange, an aspiring cop who undergoes \"transspecies\" surgery after a car accident. When he recovers, Mange has the physical prowess of a beast and must work feverishly to control his animal instincts if he is to win the heart of a perky environmental activist (Colleen Haskell). John C. McGinley, Edward Asner, Adam Sandler.

programme.title: Men in Kilts: A Roadtrip with Sam and Graham
Bloodshot
programme.desc: This adaptation of the 1990s Valiant Comics character revolves around Ray Garrison, a resurrected soldier armed with the power of nanotechnology. After regaining memories of his former life, he rebels against the scientists who created him to pursue the man who killed him.

programme.title: The Other Boleyn Girl
programme.desc: A gripping historical romance detailing the Machiavellian machinations of sisters Mary and Anne Boleyn (Scarlett Johansson, Natalie Portman) in their individual attempts to steal the heart of King Henry VIII of England (Eric Bana). Johansson and Portman are superb, and Bana makes for a dashing 16th-century monarch. Justin Chadwick directed from a script by Peter Morgan, who adapted the best-selling novel by Philippa Gregory. Jim Sturgess, Ana Torrent.

programme.title: The Professional
programme.desc: After a 12-year-old girl's family is murdered, she hides out in the apartment of her hitman-neighbor; and offers to do chores if he will teach her to be an assassin.

programme.title: Hot Tub Time Machine
programme.desc: This hilarious, raunchy comedy follows Adam and his three loser friends as they awaken after a night of drinking and hot-tubbing to find themselves back in 1986, where they try to fix all of the mistakes they made when they were younger. The foursome take advantage of this rip in the space-time continuum to win back lost loves and change their futures for the better.

programme.title: Bloodshot
programme.desc: This adaptation of the 1990s Valiant Comics character revolves around Ray Garrison, a resurrected soldier armed with the power of nanotechnology. After regaining memories of his former life, he rebels against the scientists who created him to pursue the man who killed him.

programme.title: Men in Kilts: A Roadtrip with Sam and Graham
Get Him to the Greek
programme.desc: In this uproarious buddy comedy, an intern is forced to follow rowdy rock star Aldous Snow on a trip from London to a concert in Los Angeles meant to revive his stalled career. Their trip is further complicated when Snow's arrival coincides with that of a gorgeous model-singer.

programme.title: Men in Kilts: A Roadtrip with Sam and Graham
Hot Tub Time Machine
programme.desc: This hilarious, raunchy comedy follows Adam and his three loser friends as they awaken after a night of drinking and hot-tubbing to find themselves back in 1986, where they try to fix all of the mistakes they made when they were younger. The foursome take advantage of this rip in the space-time continuum to win back lost loves and change their futures for the better.

programme.title: Behind Enemy Lines
programme.desc: Slick visuals and a rousing script recommend this action-packed war film. When a pilot's jet is shot down over Bosnia by rebel Serbs, top-gun Chris Burnett (Owen Wilson) goes on the run in enemy territory. As opposing troops and a hired assassin swarm around Burnett, a hardened American admiral (Gene Hackman) defies NATO orders and organizes a mission to rescue him. Gabriel Macht, David Keith.

programme.title: Where's My Roy Cohn?
programme.desc: A documentary on the dark legacy of Roy Cohn, a premier power broker during the McCarthy era. It charts the lawyer's Machiavellian rise to power during the Rosenberg trial, his role during Joseph McCarthy's presidency, his criminal ties to the mafia, and his mentorship of Donald Trump.

programme.title: Amelia
programme.desc: This sweeping biopic spans the life of aviator extraordinaire Amelia Earhart (Hilary Swank), whose famous voyage across the Atlantic was tragically overshadowed by her mysterious disappearance five years later. Richard Gere, Ewan McGregor.

programme.title: Hellboy
programme.desc: Ron Perlman gives a helluva performance as a quick-witted demon-turned-superhero in this entertaining adaptation of Mike Mignola's comic book. Here, he helps a secret U.S. government agency battle modern-day Nazis and interdimensional monsters. Guillermo del Toro (\"Blade II\") directed and wrote the script.

programme.title: Unlawful Entry
programme.desc: A cop (Ray Liotta) insinuates himself into the lives of a couple (Kurt Russell, Madeleine Stowe). Off. Cole: Roger E. Mosley. Graham: Ken Lerner. Penny: Deborah Offner. Lurie: Carmen Argenziano. Capt. Hayes: Andy Romano. Jonathan Kaplan directed.

programme.title: Maid in Manhattan
programme.desc: Jennifer Lopez and Ralph Fiennes team up for comedy and romance in this charming Cinderella story. Lopez stars as a chambermaid at a posh New York hotel who has a whirlwind affair with a wealthy politician (Fiennes) who thinks she is a socialite. Natasha Richardson, Stanley Tucci, Tyler Posey, Frances Conroy.

programme.title: As Good as It Gets
programme.desc: James L. Brooks' acclaimed romantic comedy about a plucky New York waitress (Helen Hunt) and a phobic, curmudgeonly novelist (Jack Nicholson). Greg Kinnear costars as his gay neighbor in this story of love, forgiveness and acceptance. The three leads were Oscar-nominated. Cuba Gooding Jr., Skeet Ulrich, Shirley Knight.

programme.title: Hellboy
programme.desc: Ron Perlman gives a helluva performance as a quick-witted demon-turned-superhero in this entertaining adaptation of Mike Mignola's comic book. Here, he helps a secret U.S. government agency battle modern-day Nazis and interdimensional monsters. Guillermo del Toro (\"Blade II\") directed and wrote the script.

programme.title: Black Hawk Down
programme.desc: In this powerful, fact-based war drama, an American mission in Somalia goes awry when enemy forces shoot down two Black Hawk helicopters and surround the soldiers on the ground. The ensuing firefight is a merciless 15-hour ordeal.

programme.title: Where's My Roy Cohn?
programme.desc: A documentary on the dark legacy of Roy Cohn, a premier power broker during the McCarthy era. It charts the lawyer's Machiavellian rise to power during the Rosenberg trial, his role during Joseph McCarthy's presidency, his criminal ties to the mafia, and his mentorship of Donald Trump.

programme.title: Born on the Fourth of July
programme.desc: Oliver Stone's docudrama about paralyzed Vietnam vet Ron Kovic, who tries to reconcile memories of his idealistic youth with his post-war disillusionment.

programme.title: Volcano
programme.desc: A subterranean tremor beneath the streets of L.A. releases a lava flow, which threatens to turn the city into a blazing inferno. Only through the efforts of an emergency chief and a geologist can the population be saved from the encroaching molten threat.

programme.title: As Good as It Gets
programme.desc: James L. Brooks' acclaimed romantic comedy about a plucky New York waitress (Helen Hunt) and a phobic, curmudgeonly novelist (Jack Nicholson). Greg Kinnear costars as his gay neighbor in this story of love, forgiveness and acceptance. The three leads were Oscar-nominated. Cuba Gooding Jr., Skeet Ulrich, Shirley Knight.

programme.title: Maiden
programme.desc: This documentary chronicles sailor Tracy Edwards' mission to participate in the Whitbread Round the World ocean yacht race with an all-female crew. Through archival footage and present-day interviews, Edwards and the rest of her 12-woman crew recount their past and the hardships they faced making history aboard their ship called Maiden.

programme.title: Buffy the Vampire Slayer
programme.desc: A high-school cheerleader has a recurring dream described by a stranger, who tells her that she is a \"slayer,\" and heir to the job of vanquishing vampires.

programme.title: Laws of Attraction
programme.desc: This rollicking throwback to the screwball comedies of the '30s and '40s crackles with witty dialogue and frantic antics. Julianne Moore and Pierce Brosnan are marvelous as mismatched attorneys who somehow fall in love. She's anti-marriage, he's all for it and something's gotta give on a business trip to Ireland. Frances Fisher, Parker Posey, Michael Sheen.

programme.title: Stepmom
programme.desc: Susan Sarandon and Julia Roberts star in this heart-tugging drama. Roberts is Isabel, a photographer whose relationship with a lawyer (Ed Harris) turns complicated when she discovers that her beau's supermom ex (Sarandon) and two children despise her. Unfortunately, it may take a life-shattering event for Isabel to finally be welcomed into the family. Directed by Chris Columbus.

programme.title: Volcano
programme.desc: A subterranean tremor beneath the streets of L.A. releases a lava flow, which threatens to turn the city into a blazing inferno. Only through the efforts of an emergency chief and a geologist can the population be saved from the encroaching molten threat.

programme.title: Steel Magnolias
programme.desc: Robert Harling adapted and expanded his stage hit, a character study set in small-town Louisiana that celebrates friendship among a group of strong-willed women who discuss their lives—especially the shortcomings of their men—at Truvy's beauty salon. Julia Roberts earned her first Oscar nomination as Best Supporting Actress for her portrayal of stubborn Shelby. Harling costars as the minister.

programme.title: Men in Black
programme.desc: Will Smith and Tommy Lee Jones star in this 1997 blockbuster, which is packed with dazzling special effects and razor-sharp wit. Jones plays Special Agent K, who recruits a New York cop (Smith) to help him protect the city from alien terrorists. The two begin by tracking a murderous extraterrestrial who has assumed the form of a farmer.

programme.title: Bridget Jones's Diary
programme.desc: Texan Renee Zellweger boasts a perfect English accent in this delightful adaptation of Helen Fielding's novel. She plays Bridget, a London \"singleton\" desperate to lose weight, cut down on her vices and find Mr. Right. The film chronicles her romantic entanglements with two gents: her playboy boss (Hugh Grant) and a snooty lawyer (Colin Firth). Jim Broadbent, Gemma Jones.

programme.title: Maiden
programme.desc: This documentary chronicles sailor Tracy Edwards' mission to participate in the Whitbread Round the World ocean yacht race with an all-female crew. Through archival footage and present-day interviews, Edwards and the rest of her 12-woman crew recount their past and the hardships they faced making history aboard their ship called Maiden.

programme.title: Stepmom
programme.desc: Susan Sarandon and Julia Roberts star in this heart-tugging drama. Roberts is Isabel, a photographer whose relationship with a lawyer (Ed Harris) turns complicated when she discovers that her beau's supermom ex (Sarandon) and two children despise her. Unfortunately, it may take a life-shattering event for Isabel to finally be welcomed into the family. Directed by Chris Columbus.

programme.title: Steel Magnolias
programme.desc: Robert Harling adapted and expanded his stage hit, a character study set in small-town Louisiana that celebrates friendship among a group of strong-willed women who discuss their lives—especially the shortcomings of their men—at Truvy's beauty salon. Julia Roberts earned her first Oscar nomination as Best Supporting Actress for her portrayal of stubborn Shelby. Harling costars as the minister.

programme.title: The Negotiator
programme.desc: In this suspenseful thriller, a Chicago police negotiator (Samuel L. Jackson) is framed for embezzlement and murder. Desperate to clear his name, he takes hostages, refusing to speak to anyone but a fellow negotiator (Kevin Spacey). It becomes a game of wits for the two negotiators, who challenge each other and the crooked cops who want Roman dead. David Morse, Ron Rifkin, John Spencer.

programme.title: Men in Black
programme.desc: Will Smith and Tommy Lee Jones star in this 1997 blockbuster, which is packed with dazzling special effects and razor-sharp wit. Jones plays Special Agent K, who recruits a New York cop (Smith) to help him protect the city from alien terrorists. The two begin by tracking a murderous extraterrestrial who has assumed the form of a farmer.

programme.title: Deuce Bigalow: European Gigolo
programme.desc: There's no need to change your dollars to euros for this hilarious sequel to the 1999 surprise hit that finds Deuce (Rob Schneider) investigating the murders of male prostitutes in Amsterdam and trying to exonerate his old pimp (Eddie Griffin). Jeroen Krabbe, Til Schweiger, Douglas Sills, Carlos Ponce, Hanna Verboom, Miranda Raison, Charles Keating.

programme.title: Bulletproof
programme.desc: Rock and Archie were once friends and partners-in-crime, but now Rock is a cop who intends to use Archie as an unwitting pawn in a scheme to bring down a powerful drug lord. Damon Wayans, Adam Sandler, James Caan, Jeep Swenson, James Farentino.

programme.title: Greed
programme.desc: Richard McCreadie is a billionaire who made his fortune by buying clothing stores and running them into the ground. For his 60th birthday, he plans a five-day party at Mykonos, even adapting a 'Gladiator' theme for it. However, with only days before the huge event, he discovers that the place is far from ready — the view is spoiled by Syrian refugees camping on the beach, bad press has caused celebrities to decline his invitation, and his man-made coliseum is still being constructed.

programme.title: Groundhog Day
programme.desc: An obnoxious weatherman finds himself reliving the same 24-hour period over and over.

programme.title: Trading Places
programme.desc: Funny business about a snobby, wealthy investment broker unwittingly switching roles with a fast-talking street hustler as part of a whimsical wager orchestrated by two billionaire brothers, and then teaming up to exact revenge on the tycoons.

programme.title: I Love You, Beth Cooper
programme.desc: This laugh-a-minute teen comedy centers on a geeky high-school student (Paul Rust) who dedicates his valedictory speech to Beth Cooper (Hayden Panettiere), the most-popular girl in school. He gets quite a shock when Beth stops by his house and shows him what a night with his dream date would be like.

programme.title: Black and Blue
programme.desc: A green cop unwittingly records the death of a drug dealer with her body camera. Reviewing the footage, she realizes that the death was no accident. She must align with the most unlikely person in her community to outwit the thugs on a vengeful warpath and her fellow officers looking to hide the truth.

programme.title: Bulletproof
programme.desc: Rock and Archie were once friends and partners-in-crime, but now Rock is a cop who intends to use Archie as an unwitting pawn in a scheme to bring down a powerful drug lord. Damon Wayans, Adam Sandler, James Caan, Jeep Swenson, James Farentino.
